1.content:
My name is Tasha Lyall, and this is my story.

High school was rough for me. What with overactive glands that gave me greasy hair and pimples, the world's thickest eyeglasses magnifying my eyes until I looked like an anime character, and being 30 pounds overweight, all I was missing was a neon sign that said MAKE MY LIFE A LIVING HELL.

To her credit, the most popular girl in school, Janelle Lee, treated me nicely, with the occasional suggestion that a vegetarian diet would do wonders for me being the worst of her behavior. Unfortunately, there's only so much she could do in the face of a student body that had decided that my name was not Tasha, but Lardass. Geez, what if I'd weighed a little more?

Fortunately, besides Janelle and her friends, I had my own friends, Elisabeth Brooks and Sarah Patterson. At home, I had my parents, Henry and Nina; my younger brother, Matt; and my cat, Clawdette.

There was also my crush, Colin Channing, but he was unaware of my feelings for him. Hell, he wasn't even the one who took me to the senior prom.

They say the senior prom is always a night to remember. Well, it certainly was for me, but not for the reasons they were thinking of.

******************************


I didn't stay long at the prom. I knew there was no chance of my being named Prom Queen. Besides, my date made it clear where I fit into the picture when he spent all his time trying to get another girl to dance with him. By the time I decided to leave, she was telling him that she was there with someone else, which ought to have been hint enough (you go, girl!).

My walk home took me through the park. I had heard stories about the park being a dangerous place at night, but I didn't have much choice. Besides, as it turned out, the stories had nothing on how dangerous it was in real life. I followed the path around the bend, and that's when I saw it.

At first, I thought it was a woman playing with her dog. Then the "dog" lifted its head, and I realized it was eating her.

I fumbled in my purse for my pepper spray, and I realized that this creature had decided that I was something that needed to be dealt with. It stood up, and I don't know what surprised me more: the fact that it was 8 feet tall, that it stood on two legs, or that it had hands.

With a howl, it jumped from the woman to me. As I finally found my pepper spray, the creature bit me.

Somehow, I managed to spray the thing. It definitely didn't like that, judging by the noise it made. As it howled, I screamed.

One or both of us made enough noise to get people's attention, and they came running. The beast heard them and ran off before they could get too close. Those people stayed with me, asking me all kinds of questions, trying to keep me conscious for as long as possible. I managed to stay awake in the park, on the ambulance, and seeing my parents in the hospital. It wasn't until they started treating the bite that I lost consciousness.

******************************


When I regained consciousness, even before I opened my eyes, I heard a familiar voice say, "... it's the waiting that's the hard part. I need to know my baby's alright."

"Mom?" I asked.

"Tasha!" she shouted, then squeezed my hand. "I'm right here, baby. Mommy's here."

I opened my eyes, and saw a blurry figure leave the room. Mom put my glasses on my face, just in time to see a doctor walk in. "You gave us quite the scare, young lady," he said. "The EMTs were honestly surprised you made it here. Guess it wasn't your time to go. How do you feel?"

"Hungry," I replied.

"I'm sure we can get you something. Don't try to do too much just yet, your stitches are still fresh." With that, he left the room.

Half an hour later, an orderly brought me breakfast. As he set it next to me, I asked him, "Isn't it kind of early to be drinking tequila?"

He looked me straight in the eye. "How'd you know I had some tequila?"

"Are you kidding? I could smell it a mile away."
1.title: A Night to Remember

11.content:
As the hours passed, I was struck by how much my nose was telling me. With just a sniff, I could tell where the cleaning staff had missed some spots. And, while I used to think of smells as either pleasant or awful, now they were interesting, with layers that told me so much.

And then there were the sounds. I could hear people talking, not just in my room, but also down the hall. For instance, I could hear a certain orderly complaining about a certain teenage patient. "So judgmental," he said. "I have a splash of tequila in my coffee, and she gets on my case about it."

He was bringing lunch, and it was only a few minutes before he got to my room. "How are you feeling?" he asked.

"Feeling pretty good, actually," I said. "But don't tell people you had a splash of tequila in your coffee: you didn't even have a splash of coffee in your tequila."

He backed out of the room, not taking his eyes off me for an instant.

When the nurse came to check on me, I asked, "When are the police coming to interview me?"

"What for?" she asked. "It was a dog attack, not a mugging."

"That was no dog. It was 8 feet tall, on two legs, and it had hands."

She shook her head. "Witnesses who rescued you said it was a wild dog. You've been through a lot. Nobody would blame you for being confused."

Confused was an understatement. Nothing was making any sense.

As she walked away, I noticed that things were getting blurry. Thinking I was tired, I took my glasses off.

As soon as I did, the world snapped back into focus.

What the hell?

Then the doctor came in. "Let's have a look at those stitches, shall we? Now, don't stress out about how it looks. At this point, it looks worse than it actually is. You'll just have some interesting scars to tell your significant other about."

He lifted the bandages. "Hmm."

I looked. The wound wasn't even black and blue. It almost looked like it was time for the stitches to come out.

"I've never seen anything like this."
11.title: I Start Noticing Things

111.content:
"Your recovery is nothing short of amazing," the doctor said. "Under the circumstances, I'd say you can go home tomorrow."

Mom and Dad hugged me and kissed me goodbye, then left to pick out something for me to wear home, since my bloody prom dress was obviously out of the question.

I ate my dinner (served by a different orderly), watched some TV, then went to sleep.

******************************


In the dream, I was running.

I wasn't running toward or away from anything, I was just running. The terrain changed, but I remained sure-footed, not even breaking my stride. No matter how far I ran, I wasn't getting tired. In fact, it felt like I could run to the ends of the earth.

When I awoke, it struck me that I had never dreamed of running before. Where did that come from?

******************************


The next morning, a different orderly brought me breakfast. When I asked about the guy from yesterday, this one just said it was his day off. However, I heard him talking to the nurses outside my room, and I knew that the other orderly had checked into a rehab facility.

Mom and Dad came back, with Matt in tow. As soon as Matt got to my bedside, we hugged each other. Sure, we had each gotten on the other's nerves several times over the years, but being attacked by whatever it was that had killed and eaten that woman put it all into perspective.

I got dressed, and a nurse wheeled me out of the hospital. As we walked to the car, I noticed a man who looked to be in his twenties, staring at me. Was that pity in his eyes? What reason did he have to pity me?

Deciding I was reading way too much into the actions of a total stranger, I brushed it off.

For the time being, anyway.
111.title: Strange Dream

1111.content:
My first clue that something seriously odd was happening to me came when we got home. If you own a cat, you know that they really are very affectionate, and they will greet you when you come home. When we got back from the hospital, however, Clawdette took one look at me and ran off. Later, she snuggled with the others, but the most I got from her was a hiss.

The first thing I did when I got home was shave my legs and underarms, which had gotten pretty hairy while I was in the hospital. You can imagine my surprise, then, when they were hairy again that night, and they were just as hairy in the morning as before I shaved.

That night, I dreamed that I was hunting deer, armed with nothing but a kitchen knife. I had a sense of accomplishment following the successful hunt, even though I thought it was too bloody when I woke up. Like the running dream, the hunting dream was crazy vivid: I swear, I could smell and taste the blood, even after I woke up.

When I went back to school, things continued to change. Both Elisabeth and Sarah hugged me when I got back, but Sarah kissed me right on the mouth, and even slipped her tongue into my mouth.

"Oh-kaaay," I said, gently pushing her off. "I didn't know you felt that way, but I'm afraid it's not a two-way street."

"I'm sorry," she said, covering her mouth. "I don't know what came over me."

Whatever it was, she wasn't the only one: everywhere I went, I suddenly had guys, and a few girls, following me. Even Brad Butler, who couldn't explain himself to Janelle Lee any better than Sarah could explain herself to me.

Not enough weirdness for you? How about this: I saw the guy from the hospital again. This time, there was no doubt he was looking at me.
1111.title: What's Happening to Me?

11111.content:
"You have got to be kidding me!" I said in exasperation. "I trimmed my nails just a couple days ago!"

Nevertheless, I was looking at fingernails and toenails that were in desperate need of a trim.

I sighed, picking up the clippers. "Underarm and leg hair may be fashionable in Europe, but nobody is trying to make long nails happen."

******************************


"Can I have more bacon?"

Mom cocked an eyebrow. "A week ago, you were asking me about going vegetarian."

I shrugged. I still ate my veggies, but meat made my mouth water.

******************************


Freaky nail growth and carnivorous cravings may sound funny, but my dreams were no laughing matter. Now, instead of running or hunting, I was killing.

Sometimes it was family. Sometimes it was friends. Sometimes it was total strangers. Always, I would pick up a readily available weapon and kill.

The two worst things about the dreams were how vivid they were, and how casually I would do it. It wasn't out of anger or frustration: I killed in my dreams only because they were there.

Mom was patient with me when I woke up screaming from these nightmares. Elisabeth got tired of me calling her at all hours, telling her about my dreams in full detail.

******************************


About a week after the attack, I stared at my reflection. I was looking at two things that, honestly, should not have been there.

First, I had absolutely no scars. A week after I almost died, there was no sign that I had been bitten.

Second, despite my increased appetite in general, and my craving for meat in particular, I was definitely losing weight. My belly didn't pooch out anymore, and my double chin was down to one and a half.

What was happening to me?
11111.title: The Strangeness Continues

111111.content:
Mom and I had just gotten back from shopping for new clothes when we saw the man again, running toward us. This time, however, he spoke. "I must speak with you!" he said. "It's a matter of life and death! Yours, and untold others'!"

"Stay back!" Mom told him. "My husband has a gun!"

He turned his eyes to me. "Have the dreams gotten bad yet? How about the hair growth? Eating more meat?"

I gasped. "How... How did you know about that? How could you know?"

"I'll explain everything, inside."

So we all went inside. "This man seems to know what's happening to Tasha," Mom explained.

"Alright," Dad said. "So tell us."

"My name is Randall Woolsey," he said. "Your daughter and I met last week."

"I don't think so," I replied.

"But we did. You see, I was the one who bit you."

"You bit her?" Dad said. "The police said it was a wild dog."

The man looked at me. "Was that any dog you've ever seen? How many dogs are 8 feet tall, walk on two legs, and have hands?"

"If you wanted to scare me," I said, "it's working."

"Good. Fear is an effective motivator. If I had been more afraid, your life would be different now. You see, I'm a werewolf. And, because you were bitten by me and survived, you're a werewolf, too."
111111.title: The Man

1111111.content:
"A werewolf?"

Okay, I'll admit it, maybe that should have occurred to me sooner, but it didn't. Now that the word had been said aloud, though, it seemed to resonate with me: there was an actual word for what was happening to me.

The rest of the family, though, needed more convincing. "Even if we believed you," Dad asked, "how did you know that Tasha was the one?"

"I didn't know her name," Mr. Woolsey replied. "But I recognized her face from that night."

"I thought werewolves weren't supposed to remember what they did in wolf form," Matt said.

"That's a Hollywood myth," Woolsey answered. "They figured it was easier to build sympathy for a character if it wasn't really him who did those awful things. No, Tasha, you won't think the way you normally do, but it's still you in there."

"If you're like this," Mom said, "you must have some way to restrain yourself. What happened, that you killed that woman and passed this on to my daughter?"

"Two things happened, Mrs. Lyall: greed and complacency. I thought I could put some extra hours in, make extra money. I figured, I've been at this for so long, surely there's no danger. But there was, and two people paid for my arrogance: one with her life, the other with the only life she'd ever known."

"So what do I do now?"

Everyone turned when I said that.

"There is good news in that regard," Woolsey said. "You live in a fairly big house in the suburbs. You can renovate the basement into a safe room, most of the things you'll need are a short drive away, and whatever isn't that close, your can get over the Internet. And your neighbors prefer not to know what you're up to.

"For your first moon set, my family can lend you an armored car where you can stay those nights. Pick yourself up about 50 lbs. or so of ground beef each night for food, and a bucket of crushed ice each night for water. Once your safe room is ready, I suggest investing in rabbits. The meat from 12 of those rabbits will satisfy a night's hunger, while the energy you expend hunting them will soothe your emotions. That will be your Plan A. Plans B and C will depend on you."

"So there's no cure?"

"Cures, Tasha, are for sick people."
1111111.title: Werewolf?

11111111.content:
I had never kept anything from my friends before, and I saw no reason to start with this. I told them one day after school, while I munched on a Slim Jim.

"You're a werewolf?" Elisabeth asked.

"I am."

"Oh my God," Sarah said, "I kissed you!"

"It's okay, Sarah," I assured her. "I have lycanthropy, not mono."

"Are you sure?" Elisabeth asked. "I mean, about you being a werewolf?"

"It fits everything: my healing, the fact that I don't need glasses anymore, my hair growth, my weight loss, my dreams."

"What do your dreams have to do with this?"

"Mr. Woolsey says it's my subconscious trying to figure out what's happening to me. He says they should ease off after my first moon set."

"Moon set?"

"The three nights in a row when I change. He also taught me some tricks to help with the worst ones in the meantime."

"Like what?" Elisabeth asked.

"Like rehearsing a different ending. Like, you know the one where I'm chasing you? Now, I practice picturing you climbing into the basket of a hot air balloon before I can get to you. The balloon takes off, and all we can do is wave to each other."

"Why am I waving at you when you wanted to kill me?"

"Please don't shoot holes in my story. Besides, you're the one who keeps telling me it's just a dream."

"Well," Sarah said, "I'll say this much for it: your face has cleared up, and your hair looks amazing."
11111111.title: I Tell My Friends

111111111.content:
About half an hour before sunset, Mom drove me out to where Mr. Woolsey said the armored car would be. "There it is," she said. "Let's see how things go from here."

Mom opened up the car, and I hauled the grocery bags full of ground beef into the back. In addition to losing weight, I had become stronger.

Once I had the last of the meat put in place, and the crushed ice in the bucket, Mom asked, "Do you have everything?"

"Let's see," I replied. "I've got two locks: one to help keep the doors closed, one for the steamer trunk. I've got $500 in cash, just in case something happens. I've got my smartphone. And Sarah put a playlist on it, to keep my spirits up while I'm waiting. Did I miss anything?"

"Just this," Mom said, giving me a hug and a kiss. "I wish I could be of more help."

"We're all doing everything we can, Mom." I climbed into the armored car. "We should do this, before it gets too late."

Mom locked the doors from the outside, and I padlocked them from inside. Then I took off my clothes, folded them, put them in the steamer trunk, and locked it. I poured the crushed ice out of the bag, then unwrapped the hamburger meat. Then, I brought up the playlist Sarah gave me, and pressed Play.

An instant later, "Born To Be Wild" filled the air.

Some songs put the boogie in my feet. Others were slow, giving me a chance to rest and eat a sandwich.

It occurred to me that I still had no idea when I would change, or what it would feel like. Looking at myself didn't help: Body hair and long nails were part of my daily reality now, so seeing them told me nothing.

About the time "She Wolf" by Shakira started up, I screamed in pain. I suddenly felt like I was burning up. If I'd had a single stitch on, I'd have torn it off.

Once the heat subsided, the pain took over. My whole body began to swell. My feet metamorphosed into paws. Fur spread over my body. My nails grew into claws, and my teeth into fangs. My ears moved to the top of my head. My face grew into a muzzle. I grew a tail.

With my transformation complete, the pain subsided, and my system flooded with endorphins. I closed my eyes, threw back my head, and howled.
111111111.title: My First Moon

1111111111.content:
Now that I was a werewolf, I had no idea why I was so worried about it. I felt great! I couldn't wait to go out and hunt!

Except I had to. Because some idiot locked me in this tiny room. I couldn't even stand up straight. Whose idea was this?

Oh, yeah, it was my idea.

I prowled the tiny room, wondering if, perhaps, I had left something to hunt in here. But there was nothing. Not even a mouse! Who lives like this?

Oh, sure, there was the ground meat. But where was the fun in that? How was I supposed to hunt something that was already dead? When I get out of here, I thought, I'm coming after the people who made that dumb decision, and I'm going to tear them limb from limb!

With nothing to hunt inside, I decided to try forcing my way out. I charged the doors as fast as I could go...

...which wasn't too fast, as it was so small. I bounced off the doors.

I searched for windows, picturing myself crawling through whatever opening there was, to wreak vengeance on these meatbags for locking me up.

No windows.

I really should have noticed that before.

Finally, with no attainable alternatives, I ate the dead meat. After that, I crunched the ice in the bucket. Once that was all gone, I relieved myself, then curled up on the steamer trunk.

As I did this, I realized that I didn't really want to tear anyone apart. I was just hungry, and I wanted to satisfy that hunger. Maybe that's why I locked myself in here, I thought.

******************************


The next morning, I woke up, feeling like I'd had the best sleep of my life. I was wide awake and full of energy. For a split second, I wondered if I had really changed, or if it was just a dream. Then I saw the massive pile of wolf scat on the floor. Nope, that was real.

I got dressed and called home. "Hello?" Mom asked.

"Hey, Mom, it's Tasha. Back in human form. I'll need a shovel and a mop, then a big breakfast. Is that okay?"

"Of course, dear. How was it?"

"I was hangry for a good chunk of it. I would have preferred to hunt for my food. So I guess we definitely need to look into those rabbits. I'm glad this will be out of the way before the graduation ceremony."
1111111111.title: First Time as a Werewolf

11111111111.content:
Graduation was a big night for me. It was after the full moon, so I could attend without fear. And Mom and I both had a laugh over the pre-ordered graduation gown, which I was almost swimming in.

Woolsey had suggested that I go to the gym to see what I was capable of now. "The last time I went to a gym," I said, "I couldn't go on social media for a month."

"That was the old Tasha Lyall," he said. "Let them see the new Tasha, then see what the internet has to say."

So I did, the morning of graduation. Sure enough, by the time I got home, #goals was trending. I decided to put up a tweet contrasting the current attitude with what they said about me two years ago, with the hashtag #TheStruggleIsReal.

But back to graduation.

I accepted my diploma in my big gown, then took it off as I walked away, revealing a tasteful outfit that better showed my figure.

After caps had been thrown to the sky, Janelle Lee came over to me. "Looking good, Lyall," she said. "I told you going vegetarian would do wonders for you."

"Actually," I replied, "I eat meat with every meal. I've learned how to make a mean steak tartare, if you know somebody who's interested."

She brushed it off. "So, where are you going now?"

"I'll be going to college locally, so I don't have to live in a dorm. There's a certain time of the month when it's best for everyone if I'm not around people."

"I hear you. Hey, I'm going to New York City to dance the night away. Wanna come with?"

"No, I don't think so." Actually , I would have loved to go dancing, and I probably would have had to be dragged off of the dance floor when she was ready to call it a night. But I figured going from Lardass to Xena was enough of a public change: going from wallflower to party animal might raise some questions.

"Suit yourself," she said, and went off.

Maybe, if I had gone dancing with her, things would have turned out differently for her.
11111111111.title: Graduation

111111111111.content:
My phone rang before my alarm clock went off, which was unusual. "Hello?"

"Tasha, it's Elisabeth. Janelle Lee still isn't home."

"What? That's not like her." Sure, Janelle went out dancing last night, but anyone who knew her would tell you that she'd do commercials for Outback Steakhouse before she'd make her folks worry.

"Do you think you could,... y'know,... sniff her out?"

"I don't know her individual scent. I can't ask for something of hers, because that would sound weird, and explaining why wouldn't decrease the weirdness factor."

******************************


I wanted to show my concern for the Lees, but I didn't want to tie up the phone, in case they found Janelle. So I went over to their house.

When Mrs. Lee answered the door, I said, "You don't know me, ma'am, but I went to school with Janelle. I know this must be so hard for you. A little over a month ago, I was in the hospital, and I think it took ten years off my folks. I guess what I'm trying to say is, I feel for you."

"Thank you, miss," she said. "When Janelle is back, we'll be sure to - " She was interrupted by the phone ringing.

Mr. Lee checked the caller ID. "It's the police."

"I'll come back later," I said, and left.

When I went back, they were helping someone who was completely covered out of the car. From what they were saying, it was Janelle. Funny thing, though, she smelled more like a cadaver.
111111111111.title: Janelle Lee Is Missing

1111111111111.content:
Woolsey gave us a call a week before the 4th of July. "I'm sure I don't need to tell you what astronomical phenomenon happens on the night of the 4th, do I?" he asked.

"No, you do not," Dad answered. Since we found out what had happened to me, we all made it a point to know the lunar cycle.

"How about if Tasha comes to our estate for the night? We're a family of werewolves, so we have everything we need in place already. The show will be miles away, so you won't even notice the fireworks."

I looked at Mom and Dad.

"Alright," Dad said, "we'll do it."

"Excellent. We'll pick you up two hours before dark, so you'll have plenty of time to settle in. And we'll have you back in time for lunch. See you then."

******************************


A car picked me up right on schedule, and I rode to the Woolsey estate. It was so big, I imagined for a moment that I would be running free that night. "It's quite a place," I said. "How do they afford it?"

"Lycans age more slowly than humans," the driver replied. "They can earn the money in a single lifetime."

That was surprising to hear, but something much more surprising to see awaited me at Woolsey Manor.

There to open the car door for me and escort me inside were two familiar faces: Brad Butler and Colin Channing.
1111111111111.title: An Offer from the Woolseys

11111111111111.content:
"Fancy meeting you here," I said to Colin.

"Likewise," he replied.

Once I was inside, a woman who managed to make a housecoat look stylish came to greet me. "Delighted to meet you, dear," she said, kissing my cheeks. "I am Susi Woolsey. My son has told me so much about you."

"All good, I hope," I replied. "If I may ask, why are those boys here? Are they werewolves, too?"

"They are thralls, Tasha. Their families have pledged service to us, in exchange for protection or political favor. We also consider adding them to the pack. Bradley is disqualified, for personal reasons which I shall not discuss. However, we still have our eyes on Colin. Join me for tea, dear, there is much I wish to discuss with you."

We sat down on the couch - or settee, as Mrs. Woolsey called it - and Colin brought us tea, serving me first, a fact which Mrs. Woolsey definitely noticed. "What did you want to discuss?" I asked.

"You are a young Lycan, Tasha. I don't know your romantic involvements, but I am sure you are in need of The Talk."

"I take it that there are a few differences between what Mom told me and what you're about to say?"

"There are, indeed. For instance, you won't get sick from any sexually transmitted diseases, but you can still carry them for roughly 24 hours, before your enhanced immune system can eradicate it.

"Now, the big difference is in pregnancy and childbirth. If you become pregnant by another werewolf, you will carry the child for three months, whereas your mother carried you for nine. If you mate with a human, your child will most likely be human, but it may be a viewolf."

"What's a viewolf?"

"Pregnancy with a viewolf lasts the same length of time as a true werewolf pregnancy. If you were human, a viewolf pregnancy would be of great concern for you, as it could kill, and has killed, many human women. A viewolf can shapeshift almost at will, but is treated as the pack Omega. They must prove themselves worthy of advancement, in all things."

"Sounds like it's in my child's best interest if Daddy's a werewolf, too."

"Indeed."
11111111111111.title: Learning from the Woolseys

111111111111111.content:
After supper, Colin led me downstairs into the cellars beneath the manor. "You will find a sturdy cabinet where you may put your things," Colin said, "and a shower for you to freshen up in the morning."

"Both are greatly appreciated," I said. "Would it be rude to ask the chef for the recipe for tonight's main course? I would like to try it out at home."

"I'll see what I can do," he said. "Rabbits will be released into your chamber after you howl."

Colin led me to an open door made of steel. As soon as I walked into the room, Colin closed and locked the door.

There was a window in the room, but it was 15 feet off the ground, and had bars set in stone. Even if I jumped up there, I would have no leverage to force out the bars. I was quite thoroughly stuck here until morning. I stripped and waited for the moon to change me.

One metamorphosis later, I howled, a sound that was returned by others in the manor. At least I wasn't completely alone. And this room was much bigger than the first place I changed.

A noise caught my attention. A small door had been opened, and something was coming into the room. Several somethings.

Prey.

The first was almost too easy. After that, though, they realized that there was a predator among them, and they ran and tried to hide. It was a good hunt.

Once I had eaten all the rabbits, I drank fresh, cool water from a trough, relieved myself, and found a clean place to curl up and fall asleep.

The next morning, I was deeply grateful for the shower. Just the thing to get dirt, sweat, and blood off of me.
111111111111111.title: The Cellars

1111111111111111.content:
As I dressed, there came a knock on the steel door. "I'm not decent," I called out.

"I'll leave the door unlocked for you, Tasha," Colin replied.

Hearing Colin say my name made my heart flutter. Wait until I tell the girls that I spent the night in the same house as Colin Channing, I thought.

As soon as I thought that, though, I reconsidered. I had no right to out him as a thrall to a family of werewolves, any more than he had the right to tell people what I did at Woolsey Manor. Our night in the same building would have to be our little secret, as delicious as I found it.

Once I was dressed, I went upstairs, to join the Woolseys for breakfast. It was the first time I had ever had a T-bone steak for breakfast, and it was delicious.

"Colin tells us that you like to cook," Mrs. Woolsey said.

"Yes, ma'am," I replied. "I want to be a chef. Or, at least, I did. Now, though, it's out of my reach." Medical bills and building the safe room had taken big bites out of my college fund.

"Perhaps not as far as you think," Mr. Woolsey said. "Culinary school classes are in the daytime, so you can still go."

"I wouldn't want you to think of me... that way."

"You can also earn money, dear," he replied. "We own a fine restaurant, which is a trifle short on waitstaff. We can hire you. Our patrons are often quite generous, and they will certainly notice when their waitress goes beyond what they're accustomed to. And you'll only need so many nights off in a month, so you'll quickly become a catch in the restaurant business. And the same will hold true when you become a chef."

"I don't know if your offer is too good to be true, or just too good to pass up. Either way, I accept."

"Excellent. Come to Lycaon at 3:00 tomorrow afternoon."
1111111111111111.title: Another Offer from the Woolseys

11111111111111111.content:
"You missed the fireworks," Matt said, as I got out of the car.

"With my hearing," I replied, "just because I didn't see or hear them doesn't mean I missed them." Turning to Mom and Dad, I said, "I got a job offer from the Woolseys. They want me to wait tables while I take cooking classes."

"That is good news," Dad said.

"I certainly didn't imagine this from that class," Mom said.

"Huh?"

"You kids know that your father and I met in college," Mom explained. "What you didn't know was that it was our minor in parapsychology that did it."

"We were both fascinated by the supernatural," Dad added. "Ghosts,... vampires,... werewolves."

That got my attention.

"We used to wonder what it would be like to meet one," Dad said. "Be careful what you wish for, huh?"

"Don't be that way, Henry," Mom said. "We wouldn't have met if it weren't for that course. So, while it's true that Tasha wouldn't be a werewolf if we weren't so curious, that's because she wouldn't exist."
11111111111111111.title: At Home

111111111111111111.content:
It was time for me to check out the safe room. I opened the steel door to the basement, to find that the staircase was now completely enclosed, with a second steel door at the bottom.

Opening that, I found the basement was now fortified and soundproofed, so the neighbors wouldn't complain about the noise once I'd transformed. Much like Woolsey Manor, there was a place to keep my clothes, and a shower where I could clean up the morning after. "Only one thing missing," I said.

"Well, a few things," Mom said. "And here they come."

Dad and Matt carried in several cages of rabbits. "You could have asked," I said. "I'm strong enough, I could have helped you cut the transfer time in half, if not more."

"I'll try to remember that," Dad said. "Anyway, you and Matt will be in charge of taking care of the rabbits, once the hutches are set up in the garage. Need anything else?"

"An answer to a question: What are we going to do with my scat?"

"That will go into the compost. Have a good night." With that, the rest of the family left the basement, locking both doors after them.

The rest of the night was, by now, becoming a routine: I put my clothes away. I changed. I howled. I hunted. I killed. I ate. I drank. I pooped. I peed. I slept.
111111111111111111.title: The Safe Room

1111111111111111111.content:
I went to Lycaon at the appointed time. "How do you do?" asked a smartly dressed woman. "I'm Emily Perkins. You must be Tasha Lyall."

"I am," I said, shaking her hand.

She brought me back to a private office. "So," she asked, "why do you want to wait tables at Lycaon?"

"What I want to do is become a chef. Waiting tables is as good a stepping stone as any."

"I want you to know, we're not one of those restaurants that serves small portions. People come here to eat full meals, and multiple courses are not uncommon."

I nodded. "You'll find I'm stronger than I look. I'm not afraid of work."

"Are there any special considerations we should have in mind, should we hire you?"

"Every four weeks, there will be three nights in a row when I am unable to work. I will alert you weeks in advance."

The interview continued for about an hour, until Ms. Perkins said, "Thank you for your time, Tasha. You can expect to hear from us soon."

She wasn't kidding. As soon as I got home, she called to let me know I had the job.
1111111111111111111.title: The Job Interview

11111111111111111111.content:
As we carried rabbits into my safe room, Matt asked me questions about my new job, mostly about what it meant for him. "Do we get to eat there free?"

"No, you don't," I replied. "Besides, they dress for dinner."

"What do you think I do, eat naked?"

"I'm talking about jackets and ties, at a minimum. You see what I'm wearing? I felt underdressed. Trust me, Matt, Lycaon is not your kind of place."

Dad nearly dropped the rabbits he was carrying. "Did you say Lycaon?"

"Yeah. Did you know somebody by that name?"

"Not personally, but... according to legend, Lycaon was the first werewolf."

"Really? What was he like?"

"He was monstrously cruel. The legend says, he ordered a young servant to be killed, then served the boy's flesh to his guest, purely for his own amusement."

"Yeesh."

Dad nodded. "Unfortunately for Lycaon, the guest was actually Zeus. He sensed the nature of what was offered to him, and flew into a rage. He cursed Lycaon, and that's how werewolves came to be."

"So I have to lock myself in the basement because of this Lycaon guy? I'm glad he's dead."

"But you'll need to be careful who you say that around, Tasha. The fact that the Woolseys named their restaurant after him may mean that someone in the family is descended from Lycaon."

That's one heck of a thing to find out about your new employers, not to mention the people who accidentally got me into this mess.
11111111111111111111.title: Learning About Lycaon

111111111111111111111.content:
Several days later, I got a call from Mrs. Woolsey. "When are you free next, Tasha?"

"I have tonight and tomorrow night off," I replied. "Why?"

"My position in the pack affords me the opportunity to make certain arrangements," she said. "I noticed, when you stayed with us, that our own Colin Channing seemed taken with you."

"He did? I mean, you think so?"

"If I am correct in my belief that his interest is reciprocated, my dear, that would mean that the two of you might make a good match. Am I correct?"

"I... well,... Yes, ma'am, I'm interested."

"Splendid, Tasha. Colin will call on you tomorrow, to arrange the details. You needn't feel rushed. In fact, we prefer long dating periods. You see, much like wolves, we prefer mating for life."

"I see. Well, thank you for your interest, ma'am. I'll look forward to his call. Goodbye."

"What was that about?" Mom asked, as I hung up.

"Apparently, Mom, I've just been fixed up by Mrs. Woolsey. With Colin Channing, no less."
111111111111111111111.title: Dating a Thrall

1111111111111111111111.content:
I shared the news (minus one or two deets) with Elisabeth and Sarah.

"Holy shit!" was Elisabeth's reaction. "You're actually going to be dating Colin Channing?"

"I know, right? If you told me a year ago that I'd be going out with him, I'd have made you take a drug test."

"Before or after I told you you'd also be a werewolf?"

Elisabeth and I laughed, but Sarah seemed to be studying me. "What's on your mind, girlfriend?" I asked.

"Tasha, if you had some big news, you'd share it with me, wouldn't you?"

"What do you mean? I told you I was a werewolf, and I just told you I'd be going out with Colin Channing."

"Are you pregnant?"

"What?! Sarah, I know for a fact that I'm not pregnant, because I'm riding a cotton pony as we speak."

"Sorry, it's just... You used to get real bad PMS."

"Oh. Well, I don't get it anymore. I guess my body decided, I've got the one change in my personality, PMS would be redundant."

"I don't know which I envy more about you: no more PMS, or your figure."

"Just remember what goes along with that: my legs are permanently hairy, and I have to lock myself in the basement so I don't kill my brother."
1111111111111111111111.title: The Girls React

11111111111111111111111.content:
Colin came to my house at 5:45 the next evening. After a polite hello to my folks, we were off on our date.

He took me to Manganiello's, the new Italian restaurant in town. "I hope this isn't a letdown after working at Lycaon," he said.

"No, this is fine," I assured him. "My best outfit feels like a torn T-shirt and ratty jeans compared to what they wear at Lycaon, anyway."

Once we were seated, he said, "Please, feel free to order and eat anything you like. I'm familiar with Lycan appetites, so it won't upset me."

"Okay," I said, "but don't say you weren't warned." I was always self-conscious about how much I ate now, even though I knew that, between my metabolism and my metamorphoses, I'd have to be a pretty dedicated glutton to pack on the pounds again.

Dinner was excellent. My enhanced senses loved everything about Manganiello's. I made a mental note to tell Mom and Dad about it.

After dinner, we went dancing. Now, before prom night, I wouldn't say I had two left feet, but I didn't dare try any fancy dance moves. Now, though, I trusted my feet more.

Eventually, it came time for our date to end, and Colin took me home. "I had a good time," I said, as Colin walked me to the door.

"I'm glad," he replied. "So, can I call you tomorrow?"

"I'd like that."

And then came the moment I fantasized about all through high school: Colin Channing kissed me. On the lips. Honestly, I have no idea how I remained standing when it was over.

Mom opened the door. "Did you kids have a good time?"

"We sure did, Mrs. Lyall," Colin answered. "I'll call you tomorrow, Tasha." With that, he left.

Mom brought me inside. "Hi, sweetheart," Dad said.

"Hi," I replied.

"How was your date?"

"Hi," I replied.

"I'd say it went well," Mom said. "Go on up to bed, Tasha. We'll talk more in the morning."

"Hi," I replied.
11111111111111111111111.title: My First Date with Colin

111111111111111111111111.content:
"So how are things going with Colin?" Elisabeth asked, on the way to the movies.

"It's going well," I replied.

"Did you do the dirty deed?" asked Sarah.

"We're taking it slow," I told her. "Werewolves mate for life, and we age a lot slower than regular people. We've got time." Besides, Mrs. Woolsey told me that we howl when we orgasm, so I wanted to keep that a secret until he became one of us.

Elisabeth sprang for the movie tickets, so I went to get the refreshments. I spotted Brad in line behind me. "Seeing a movie yourself?" I asked.

"I'm on a date," he said.

"What is that smell?"

"The reason I won't become a Lycan," he replied. "She's a vampire. Don't talk to her, because vampires and werewolves are supposed to avoid each other."

I got popcorn and sodas for me and the girls, then joined them. They were talking to a girl whose voice I recognized as Janelle Lee. They teased her about not recognizing them, and they introduced themselves.

"Now I know you two," she said. "You were always hanging out with Tasha Lyall. What's she been up to?"

"Staying out of trouble," I replied. "You?"

"The same," she said, and turned to face me. When she did, I almost dropped the popcorn and sodas.

Janelle looked dead.

I don't mean she was tired-looking. I mean she looked like a corpse. She smelled like one, too. And, when she smiled, I saw fangs.

That's when I put two and two together: Janelle was a vampire. And, from the looks she was giving me, she now knew I was a werewolf.

"What, uh, what are you doing?" I asked.

"Cab driver. You?"

"Waitress. But I hope to be a chef one day."

We went on like that, until Brad came to Janelle with the refreshments, which were all for him. I didn't mind her leaving: I didn't want to test the truce between vampires and werewolves, and I don't think she did, either.
111111111111111111111111.title: I See a Vampire

1111111111111111111111111.content:
Over the next two days, when I wasn't busy with work or dating, I spent my free time thinking of how to get in touch with Janelle. She and I were both new at this, and I figured it wouldn't be a completely bad idea for us to be in touch, albeit without the knowledge of those higher up in our respective communities.

Finally, it struck me: Janelle said she was a cab driver. So, in order to find her, I asked Mom and Dad to do a little digging, to find out who the youngest cabbie working nights at each company was. Even without asking her name, it didn't take long for us to find an 18-year-old girl driving for the Knightley Cab Company.

Next, I checked my work schedule, to find a night when I would be working late. With that information, I got a lift to work from Mom, then asked the Knightley dispatcher to send Janelle to pick me up and take me home.

Right on schedule, Janelle drove up just as I was walking out of Lycaon. I gave her my address, and we were off.

"So," I said, "you're a cab driver now."

"And you're a waitress," she replied. "How's the food? Tourists are always asking for recommendations."

"The food is wonderful," I answered, "and I'm not just saying that because they pay me the medium-sized bucks. For people of more modest means, give Manganiello's a try."

Now it was time for us to talk about the elephant and the 800-pound gorilla in the cab. "How long have you been a vampire?"

"You remember graduation night, when I went off to dance the night away? I snuck into this underground rave, four guys bit me, and I woke up in the morgue. When did you become a werewolf?"

"Prom night. The guy who took me wanted to dance with someone else, so I went home early. I was walking through the park, and I saw this beast eating somebody. It attacked me, and I used my pepper spray on it. It ran off, but not before it bit me. As I recovered, I realized I was going through some changes. Then this guy shows up, says he's a werewolf, and he was the one who attacked me, so now I'm a werewolf, too." I paused, then asked, "What do I look like to you?"

"Truth? You're covered with fur, and you smell like an animal. What do I look like?"

"You look like death warmed over, and you smell even worse."

Things got quiet for a while after that. Then, Janelle said, "I envy you."

"You envy me? What for?"

"You can walk in the sunshine like it's no big deal. You can eat food. You can have children. All that was taken away from me."

"You can run around every night of the month. No matter when, you always think like yourself."

"Twilight made us look stupid."

"Trust me, nobody looked good in Twilight."

As we pulled up to my house, she asked, "Would you like for me to make sure you get in safely?"

"Not necessary. Thanks for the ride." I gave her a $10 tip.

"I hope your car is out of the shop soon."

"My car is fine," I told her. "But you and I got to talk this way."
1111111111111111111111111.title: Getting Around the Truce

11111111111111111111111111.content:
The next evening, I was on a meal break at Lycaon. Truth be told, it was the only way I could afford to eat there. Oh, well, the food was good anyway.

To my surprise, three people who definitely did not work at Lycaon walked into the break room. A woman and two men. The fact that the men stood behind the woman told me she was the leader, and the way she smelled told me she was a vampire.

"Tasha Lyall?" she asked, with a hint of an Irish accent.

"Who's asking?"

"My name is Aoife. This is Cain to my left, and Slade to my right. We are the cleaning crew. It's our job to preserve the Masquerade that werewolves don't really exist."

"Then you should have spoken to one Randall Woolsey, two and a half months ago."

"Oh, we've had words with that gobshite, colleen, make no mistake. But we're here on another matter. We understand that you've been in contact with a vampire."

"Present company excluded?"

She ignored what I said. "What was the purpose of your contact?"

I suppose I could have given her a smart answer about a cab ride, but I had a pretty good feel for the room, and I knew that would get me nowhere. "We kinda sorta knew each other in high school, and I wanted to touch base. Is that a problem?"

"For our purposes, it's sound as a pound. For centuries, werewolves and vampires have strictly avoided each other, after thousands of years of trying to kill each other. Many of us, in both communities, feel it's time for a change." She sat down across from me. "We want to reach out, test the waters, as it were. That's where you come in."

"Are you kidding? I'm a waitress. You want a diplomat."

"What we want is someone with a friend on the other side. That's you, and that's Janelle Lee, and that's devil a one else. You and she will be our secret diplomats. You carry on with her, as you've been doing. Then you tell me, and Janelle tells my sister, what's the craic. We want peace between us, Tasha. Show us the way there." With that, she and her cohorts left.

My first move was to call Janelle. She answered on the second ring. "Hello?"

"Janelle, you're not going to believe this, but an Irish vampire whose name I can't pronounce wants me to be a diplomat."

"That would be my sister, Aoife," said a voice that sounded familiar. In fact, she sounded almost exactly like my vampiric dinner guest. She must be the sister, I thought.

"As you might have gathered," Janelle said, "it's a bit easier for me to believe than you thought. So, what do you say?"

"I guess I'm in."

"Ditto. Call me tomorrow afternoon, we'll start figuring this out."
11111111111111111111111111.title: The Cleaning Crew

111111111111111111111111111.content:
"What's going on, sis?" Matt asked me.

"I'm getting ready for an important meeting," I replied.

"I thought you said that restaurant was super formal."

"It is. But that's not what the meeting's about."

"Can I come?"

"I doubt you'd be interested, Matt. It's your worst nightmare: Two girls talking about matters that don't concern you." If there was something that made him lose interest faster than the Bechdel test, I had yet to find it.

At least, that's what usually happened. "I've got nothing else going on. Take me with."

"You wouldn't have anything to do there, either. It's a house full of girls."

As soon as I said it, I regretted it. The prospect of meeting a girl was exactly the wrong thing to appeal to, if I wanted him to lose interest.

As if to make it worse, Mom poked her head in. "Tasha, honey, why don't you take Matt along for your little get-together? I'm sure he'll find something to keep him out of your hair."

Great. So that was it: The future of vampire/werewolf relations resting on my shoulders, and I had to bring my stupid brother with me. Did they have to deal with this at the United Nations?
111111111111111111111111111.title: Getting Ready for the Meeting

1111111111111111111111111111.content:
Mrs. Lee greeted us at the door. "May I help you?" she asked.

"I'm Tasha Lyall," I said. "I'm here to talk to Janelle."

She stepped aside. When we walked in, she asked, "Do I know you?"

"I came to pay my respects when Janelle was missing. Before we knew what happened."

"Oh, yes." She looked at me intently. "Did something... happen to you?"

I nodded. "I'm a werewolf."

She arched an eyebrow. "Vampires and werewolves have had as little to do with each other as they could, for centuries."

"They're looking to change."

She led us to the basement. "Can I get you kids anything?"

"I'll have a soda," Matt said.

"Anything for me," I added.

I knocked on the door, then opened it. "Hey, Janelle. This is my little brother, Matt. My mom made me bring him along."

"Hey, Tasha. Hey, Matt. This is my little sister, Courtney. She needs something to do, too."

Courtney came up the stairs. "I guess it's my job to keep you entertained," she said, taking Matt's hand.

With our younger siblings tending to each other, I turned to Janelle. "So, how much did they tell you about the start of the vampire/werewolf feud?"

"Not a thing. You?"

"Ditto. How are we supposed to create peace, when we don't even know why there was a war?"

"Dunno. Finola just said she wanted us to try being friends, and that I should tell her what works and what doesn't."

"They sure are confident in our abilities, aren't they?"

"I'm not sure it's a question of confidence. Vampires and werewolves haven't been getting along for centuries, millennia, even. Maybe we're the first ones who were on a first-name basis."

I nodded. "I heard about this one thrall, they wouldn't turn him into a werewolf, because he was going out with a vampire. A culture like that, it's gotta be hard to break through."

Mrs. Lee brought me a soda, then left. "How's being a werewolf treating you?"

"I have a cat, Clawdette. After I was bitten, she hissed at me and avoided me. She's calmed down now, she just watches me when I'm around. Hopefully, she'll start accepting treats from me again."

"I'm sure she will. I've read that cats are far more social than people give them credit for. She'll work out that you're still her person."

I hugged her. Hers were the first words of hope offered to me on the subject of Clawdette.
1111111111111111111111111111.title: The Meeting

11111111111111111111111111111.content:
As it came time for this, our first meeting, to end, Janelle saw me to the basement door. "I liked this," she said. "Maybe, next time, we can make it a girls' night out."

"I'd like that, too," I replied. Taking out my smartphone, I checked my work schedule against the lunar cycle. "I've got a couple nights off coming before the moon. I'll call you later, and we can set it up."

Since the hallway was dark, Janelle was able to walk into it, and she gave me a hug. Possibly the first nonviolent contact between a vampire and a werewolf in some time.

Mrs. Lee came. "How did everything go?" she asked. For someone who had only recently been introduced to the world of the supernatural, she seemed to appreciate the importance of our meeting.

"I think it went well, Mrs. Lee," I said. "Thanks for having us over. I hope Matt wasn't too difficult for you."

"Not at all. They've been sitting quietly this whole time."

I looked past Mrs. Lee. Matt and Courtney were sitting together on the sofa. Matt had his arm around her, and she didn't seem to mind.

"Feck."

I turned to Janelle, as did her mother.

"Sorry," Janelle said. "I must have picked it up from Finola." She cleared her throat and called out, "What are your intentions toward my sister?"

Matt and Courtney both jumped. "We... we weren't doing anything," Matt stammered. "We were just... just sitting here."

"We'll talk about this later, Matt," I said. Turning back to Mrs. Lee, I said, "Thanks again for having us, Mrs. Lee. You have a lovely home."

******************************


As we drove back home, Matt said, "Tasha, I swear, we didn't do anything."

"I know you didn't, Matt. Even if I didn't trust you, my senses told me nothing untoward happened. But we were in the house of an angry vampire, and I had to get you out of there."

"Why do you think Courtney's sister acted like that?"

"She was looking to protect her little sister. Courtney was ovulating."

"So what if she's on the rag?"

"Not menstruating, Matt, ovulating. She's fertile. And Janelle didn't want you sniffing around."

Matt slumped in his seat. "I guess you think I shouldn't see her again."

"I didn't say that, and I don't mean that. My goal is to establish a peaceful settlement between vampire and werewolf, and I think a romantic relationship may do just as much good as girlfriends. But you may need to be careful, until Janelle comes around."
11111111111111111111111111111.title: Continue

111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As I drove home from Lycaon, the phone rang. I pulled over and answered it. "Yeah?"

"Hey, girlfriend," Sarah said. "Whatcha got going on?"

"I'm on my way home from work. Why?"

"How's a movie sound?"

"I'm a half hour away from my house. Let me change out of my work clothes."

"Okay. We'll come pick you up." Then she hung up.

******************************


The movie was pure escapist fun. Perfect for relaxing things before I made my announcement. "I've got a job to do on my nights off."

"How do you have a job to do when it's your night off?" Elisabeth asked.

"Pack business."

"What's the job?" Sarah asked. "Can we help?"

"Werewolves and vampires haven't gotten along for centuries, and they want me to fix it."

"Why you?"

"Because I'm on a first-name basis with a vampire. Remember when Janelle Lee went missing? She was attacked by vampires, and they killed her. Now, she's one of the undead. And I get to talk peace with her."

"First werewolves, now vampires," Sarah said. "Can I ask you something?"

"Sure."

"When you've got an idea of how the peace talks are going, can you hook me up with somebody?"

"Me, too?" added Elisabeth.

We all laughed.
111111111111111111111111111111.title: A Movie with My Girlfriends

1111111111111111111111111111111.content:
The following night, I was off from work, so to spend an evening working on the peace process with Janelle. I took Sarah and Elisabeth with me, only because those outside of the inner circle knew we were having a girls' night out. We met with Janelle, who seemed to have the same idea, as she arrived with two girls of her own, who I recognized as Mindy and Zooey. We nodded at each other, and our 'escorts' did the same.

"So, how does this work, exactly?" Curious, Sarah asked.

"We are simply to be friends, and let the cleaning crews worry about the politics." Simply, I replied. "Eventually, if they still want it, Elisabeth and Sarah will be my thralls."

"What is a thrall?" Confused, Elisabeth asked.

"A thrall is a servant who 'belongs' to the vampire or, in your case, the werewolf." Serious, Janelle explained. "They agree to this contract for the possibility of later becoming one themselves, and/or earning political favor."

"It has its ups and downs." Darkly, I replied. "Be certain you know what you are agreeing to... this is a lifetime contract, no easy way out once it is signed."

"On a lighter note, Janelle and I decided that tonight would be perfect for Mindy and Zooey to know more about werewolves." Calmly, I said. "Also, for Sarah and Elisabeth to know more about vampires."

"How?" Raising an eyebrow, Sarah asked.

"Through sharing our stories and answering questions." simply, I replied. "This way, we are all on the same page." Pausing, I added, "You will all be getting a protection glyph very soon."

"What's that?" Curious, Zooey asked.

"It's a tattoo that marks you as under the protection of either the vampires or the werewolves." Serious, I replied. "Both societies use them as silent warning signs that normal people easily dismiss."

"So... who is going to tell their story first?" Wincing, Elisabeth asked.
1111111111111111111111111111111.title: Girls' Night with a Vampire

11111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"I'll go first," I said, and recounted again the story of how I was attacked, and eventually learned that I was becoming a werewolf.

"What's it like to be a werewolf?" Zooey asked.

"It has its ups and downs," I replied. "On the plus side, I heal quickly, I age slowly, and my metabolism burned right through those extra pounds I was carrying. On the minus side, the big problem is, I have to lock myself away for three nights every month. In Lycan form, I have poor impulse control, at least until I've eaten. Also, the reason I quit shaving is because my leg and underarm hair grows like crazy. And I have to keep on top of my nail growth: they need a trim every three days. My first month after the attack, I had weird and terrifying dreams, as my subconscious tried to deal with what I was becoming."

"I think I get the picture on what you're going through," Mindy said. "How about you and Janelle? How does her being a vampire affect your interactions?"

I turned to Elisabeth and Sarah. "How does Janelle look to you?"

Elisabeth shrugged. "She's kind of pale, but, other than that, she looks the same."

"And the way she smells?"

Elisabeth shrugged, leaned over, sniffed Janelle, and shrugged again. "Her shampoo and body wash smell kind of funny, but that's it."

"Well, to me, Janelle looks and smells like a walking corpse."
11111111111111111111111111111111.title: I start first.

111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"My turn," Janelle said. "The night after graduating, I went to New York City, to party it down. I found an underground rave, and I snuck in. I met this guy named Micah, who seemed pretty cool. He got me a soda, and I was having a good time. I was about halfway through my soda when I realized it had been drugged. Micah and three of his friends carried me out the back into the alley, and then they bit me. The next thing I knew, I was lying on a slab in the morgue, and I woke up just in time to prevent my autopsy. That's where I realized I had become a vampire."

"And what's that like?" Sarah asked.

"Well, I'm immortal, I'm strong, and I can manipulate the weak-minded, like a Jedi. On the other hand, sunlight hurts me, I can't eat or drink anything but blood, and I can't have children."

"And you and Tasha?"

"I see her covered in fur, and she smells like an animal to me."
111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Janelle's Story

1111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Colin took me to Manganiello's for our date. "How are the peace talks coming along?" he asked.

"I couldn't tell you," I replied. "Janelle and I are building a friendship, and letting the leaders work out centuries of conflict. As for friendship, we brought together our circles of friends last night."

"Good enough." He paused to eat. "I'm not going to be a thrall much longer."

"Why not? I thought you liked it. Did you get in - " And then it dawned on me. "You're joining the pack."

He nodded. "The next moon. What do you think?"

"Well, it may take some time to get used to seeing you with a beard. But I'm happy for you." I kissed him. "You'll make a gorgeous werewolf."

With Colin's announcement, it felt like there was something in the air between us. The food, already good, tasted better. The drinks had more kick. And I felt another appetite building within me.

So did Colin. "Instead of the movie," he suggested, "how about we go for a drive? See where the night takes us?"

"I'd like that," I said, knowing exactly where I hoped the night would take us.

Sure enough, we went to the Lookout, a well-known destination for young people in love who wanted to do things they couldn't do at home. Colin parked the car, and we went to the backseat.

We began kissing even before we shut the doors. Rather than pull our hands away to take off our own clothes, we took off each other's.

Our bodies were one, and I howled.

In the afterglow, I said, "I'm sorry, I don't know - "

He shut me up by kissing me. "It's okay."
1111111111111111111111111111111111.title: My Date with Colin

11111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"There was a phone call for you," Emily told me, as I collected my dinner. "She asked that you return her call on your break." She handed me a phone number.

I knew that the call itself wasn't important, because it hadn't interrupted my shift. I knew that the caller must be important, because Emily gave me the information without lecturing me about personal calls while I was working, the way she had others on the waitstaff. Sure enough, when I read the number, I recognized it as Susi Woolsey's.

Before eating, I returned the call. "Tasha, dear, how good of you to call. How have you been?"

"I think I've adjusted pretty well," I replied. "I would think of my moon sets as inconveniences, if it weren't for the fact that I'm fully capable of murder those nights."

"Speaking of which," she said, "would you care to join us at the manor for those nights? Feel free to bring the family, we would love to have you all."

Her words sounded like a casual invitation, but the underlying tone spoke of a woman accustomed to getting her way. Getting out of this would require serious diplomacy. "I wouldn't want to impose on you, ma'am," I said, trying to match her jaunty manner. "And my brother would be an imposition."

"Nonsense, dear, he can't be that bad. He was raised by the same woman who raised you, after all." Damn. She was determined not to let me out of this easily.

I conceded that she was higher up in the pack than I was. "I will pass along your invitation, ma'am, and let you know later." If anyone in the family had a prior commitment, I could at least get them out of the invitation.

What a miserable time for the only pressing issue to be Dad's drive to work. I accepted the invitation, bracing myself for Matt to embarrass me somehow.
11111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Invitation

111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
I got two pleasant surprises on the day my family and I went to Woolsey Manor.

The first was Clawdette sitting next to me on the couch. She had avoided me since I came home from the hospital after I was bitten. But she sat next to me now, and even let me scratch her between her ears. After months of isolation from her, I was accepted.

The second surprise came when we arrived at Woolsey Manor, and Matt actually behaved himself. I expected him to say and do every embarrassing thing possible, with the possible exception of walking around without pants on, but he behaved, if not like a perfect gentleman, at least like someone who had been allowed out of the house before now.

Mrs. Woolsey seemed like she was going to compliment Matt on his comportment, but, before she could, a blur of motion knocked him down.

I was about to ask when the Woolseys had gotten a dog, when I looked, and saw that Matt had been knocked down by a girl. "Hi," she said.

"Uh,... hi?"

Mrs. Woolsey pulled the girl to her feet. "Luna, these are the Lyalls: Henry, Nina, Tasha, and Matt. This is my goddaughter, Luna."

"Delighted to make your acquaintance, Luna," Mom said, as she helped Matt to his feet.

Luna sniffed me. "You're a Lycan." Then she sniffed the others. "You aren't." Getting back to Matt, she asked, "Do you have a girlfriend?"

"Courtney," I said. "Janelle's sister."

"A Lycan's brother and a vampire's sister," Mrs. Woolsey said. "There's hope for the next generation."
111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Family at Woolsey Manor

1111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As on the Fourth of July, Colin escorted me to my cell. "What can you tell me about Luna?" I asked.

"She is a born Lycan," he replied. "Mrs. Woolsey found her out in the forest. The poor thing had gone through her first moon with no prior knowledge. Her parents were killed by a monster hunter, you see."

At that moment, Luna ran past us, heading for her own cell. Unlike myself, she didn't wait until she was locked in to take off her clothes. She was down to her bra and panties by the time she reached the dungeon, and was stark naked before she reached the door to her cell. A thrall followed her, picking up her clothes. The expression on her face as she shook her head told me that, in Luna's short time at the manor, she had become known for this behavior.

I kissed Colin goodnight, and he locked me in. I took off my clothes and put them away.

After I changed, I howled. My howl was joined by others in the pack, including one who couldn't have been more than a cub.

I liked hunting rabbits, because no two ever ran the same way. I had to think in order to catch them, and their terror made the meat taste better. Much better than the ground beef I had to eat my first moon set.

My belly nearly full, I drank from the trough, then relieved myself, and I curled up in a pile of hay.

That was when the cell door opened.

My ears picked up as the intruder, who smelled familiar, approached. I wanted to sleep. Why did this human want to bother me? I gave a warning growl.

The human ignored my growl, reaching toward me.

I growled louder. Nevertheless, he persisted.

He touched my arm, and I had enough. I sank my fangs into his arm.

That seemed enough, as the human backed away. I settled back into the hay pile. It occurred to me that there were some consequences to the bite of a werewolf.

Just before I fell asleep, I recognized the scent of the human who had come into my room.

It was Colin.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Full Moon

11111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
As usual, I washed and dressed after I woke up. However, it was a different thrall who came to let me out. "Is Colin alright?" I asked.

"He is resting," the thrall replied. "As you know, it takes a while."

That confirmed it. I had bitten Colin last night. It was by me that he was initiated into the pack.

******************************


After breakfast, I asked Mrs. Woolsey, "May I see Colin?"

"Of course, dear. But remember what it was like for you those first days."

Colin was sitting up when I came to his room. "Tasha! Good to see you!"

"I just wanted to make sure you were okay. I didn't think I bit you too badly, but it's hard to tell when it isn't your arm that's being bitten."

"You did perfectly, my love. It was an honor, and a privilege, to be bitten by you."

I sat on his bedside. "How is it for you? I imagine knowing what's coming makes it easier."

"For the most part. The dreams scare me."

"Yeah, they get pretty bad. But you'll only have them for a month. And there are some tricks that can make them more manageable." I kissed him. "Call me if they get too bad."

He kissed back. "I promise."

I kissed back. "I'm holding you to that."

We started going further, and I even started getting undressed and climbing into bed with him, when Mrs. Woolsey cleared her throat. "I think he needs his rest before you administer that form of therapy," she said. "Besides, the corridors aren't soundproofed, and I don't know if you want everyone on this side of the manor to hear you howl."
11111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: The Next Morning

111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
After Dad left for work, Mom, Matt, and I were watching TV in the lounge when Luna came in. "What are you doing?" she asked.

"We're watching TV, Luna," Mom said. "You're welcome to join us, if you'd like."

As she sat down, I said, "Tell us about yourself, Luna."

She eyed me warily. "Why do you want to know?"

"We're both members of the pack. I'd like to know more about you."

"This is my third pack, and my second Lycan pack."

"You have my undivided attention."

"My... my parents died... five years ago."

"Five years? Where were you before they found you?"

"With the wolves. They welcomed me."

She had been partially raised by wolves. That must be why she took off her clothes on the way to the dungeon. "And then Mrs. Woolsey welcomed you into her pack. You are among your own kind again."

"You understand."

"Humans, wolves, and Lycans," Mom said. "We all like to feel that we belong. That's why we invited you to sit with us, Luna. You are among friends."

Luna got up and walked over to Mom, then snuggled up with her like a puppy.

"How did you like the rabbits?" Matt asked.

"I like them. They're fluffy, and they're fun to play with. The Woolseys saw it, and called me Cub."

"Wow. Part of me is looking forward to seeing my cat, Clawdette, again. Another part worries about what might happen if she decides to join me in my safe room at home."

"We'll keep an eye on her, Tasha," Matt said. "Don't worry about a thing."
111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Getting to Know Luna

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Luna stayed close to me when it came time to head to the dungeon. "How did you join the pack?" she asked.

"Involuntarily. I was bitten out in the open, in town. Mrs. Woolsey and her family helped me out." I omitted the fact that Randall Woolsey was the one who bit me. No need for her to be mad at him over it at this late date.

"So it's like Mrs. Woolsey took you in, too," she said, taking off her top.

"Now that you mention it, I suppose it is. Are you more comfortable without your clothes?"

She nodded. "Especially when the moon is coming. Don't you take off your clothes before you change?"

"Yes, but I wait until I'm behind closed doors to do it."

She had been just about to take off her shorts when I said this. "Should I wait?"

"I think the thrall in charge of locking you in would appreciate not having to take care of your clothes for you."

She turned to address the thralls behind us. "Sorry." Turning back to me, she said, "I know we're both part of the pack, but, if you think about it, being taken in by Mrs. Woolsey kind of makes us sisters."

"Now that you mention it, I suppose it does."

She hugged me. "I never had a sister before."

I hugged her back. "Can you keep a secret?"

"Mmm-hmm."

"I love Matt, and I never want anything to happen to him,... but I've always wanted a little sister."

"I'll be your sister, if you'll be mine."

"Deal."

"Can I spend the moon with you?"

I shook my head. "It's all set up this way. Besides, I don't play with my rabbits." I licked my lips for emphasis.

"Oh."

With that, we went to our rooms and got locked in.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: That Night

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
Staying with the Woolseys was fun, and it was nice to snuggle with Colin, but it was time for us to return home. I hugged Colin for a long time. "I can't get over how your scent has changed," I told him.

"I still smell good, I hope," he replied.

"You smell wonderful. It really does things to me."

"Down, girl," Mom said. "No need for you to start having kids right away."

That was true. I was a werewolf, and involved in the peace process, but I was still a girl about to start college. "We've got to work on taking this slow."

"It's no easier for me," Colin assured me. "But, if you can do it, I can do it."

Next, I said my goodbyes to Luna. "You've got my phone number and my e-mail address?"

"I'll talk to you every day, sis."

I felt a little sad as we went back home. Colin and Luna were two reasons why, but Woolsey Manor felt like home in another way. There, I was part of the pack. Back home, I was the one who was different.

Elisabeth was there when we got home. "Thanks for cat-sitting for us, Elisabeth," Mom said, paying her.

"Anytime," she replied.

As soon as I walked in, Clawdette wove herself between my legs, just like she did before I became a werewolf. Laughing, I bent down, and she jumped into my arms. "I missed you, too, kitten. I've missed you for so long."

Clawdette purred. Now I felt like I was home again.
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Heading Home

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"You're looking well," Emily said, as I clocked in.

"I'm feeling well," I replied. If I could have, I would have told her all about my three days at Woolsey Manor. Initiating my boyfriend into the pack and finding a sister are pretty heady developments, after all.

"If I could," Emily said, "I'd ask you to tell me where you go and what you do on the three days and nights you're off. It seems like, some days, I could really use it, myself."

I said nothing. After all, on those nights, I turned into a hairy monster that only wanted to hunt, kill, and eat.

"But there is one question I can ask you: How do you know the owners?"

I shrugged. "I did Mrs. Woolsey a favor once, and she said she'd repay me." Not much of a story, but plausible. And it wouldn't scare Emily nearly as much as finding out that werewolves exist, and she's surrounded by them.

******************************


After working for several hours, I was glad for my break. I wasn't tired (though I acted like I was), but I was hungry, and the rare steak I got was calling my name.

As I sat down to eat in the breakroom, Emily came knocking. "May I come in?"

"If you want."

She sat down. "Since we're in private," she said, "there are two things I wanted to say. The first is, whatever the real story of how you know the Woolseys is, what you told me at the start of your shift isn't it."

"I'm sorry you feel that way. The second thing?"

"I've figured it out."

"Figured what out?"

"That you're a werewolf."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Back to Work

1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.content:
"A werewolf?" I put down my knife and fork. "You think that werewolves are real? And that I'm one of them?"

"I'm not kidding, Tasha," Emily replied. "I've known that werewolves are real since I was little."

She sat down with me. "I was four or five. My family went camping in the woods outside of town. I don't remember why, but, one night, I'd become separated from the rest of my family. I was wandering around, trying to find the way back to our camp. And that's when I saw them. There were five of them, and they were gathered around some dead deer. And then one of them looked up and saw me.

"I ran, as fast as I could, and found a place to hide from them. Like there's such a thing as hiding from a werewolf. When one of them caught me, I was sure I was dead."

"But you weren't," I said.

"They must have eaten their fill of the deer," Emily continued. "They gathered around me, and one of them held me to her breast and gave me milk. I fell asleep with them all around me.

"When I awoke the next morning, the werewolves were gone, and a woman I'd never seen before led my family straight to me. She was holding a baby, and kept talking about how terrified she would be if something happened to her children. I knew she was the werewolf who nursed me."

I had gone back to eating my steak, and was chewing as she finished. "That's quite a story."

"It happened, all of it. I've been interested in werewolves ever since; I even took a course in parapsychology in college. And now, I have a young woman working for me who is stronger than the rest of the wait staff, and who takes off work when the moon is full."

When I finished eating, I gathered my dishes. "I might get into trouble, if this got to the wrong ears," I said. "But you're right: I am a werewolf."
1111111111111111111111111111111111111111.title: Emily Knows!

12.content:
The orderly raised a single eyebrow. "Curious... " Softly, he said.

Without another word, he left the room, where I saw him briefly talk to two men and a woman in black business suits before moving on. The two men had black hair and the woman was a redhead, but that was all I could see of them. I felt a chill run down my spine as they turned my way. All of them had pale faces and wore sunglasses. Their expressions were cold, almost emotionless, as they then walked on without saying a word. I shuddered at the experience and made a note to mention them when the police questioned me later. Strangely, though, no police officer came to get my statement. I asked a nurse about it, who could only shrug. "All I can tell you, miss, is that, during a full moon, there is a rise in homicide cases in the area." Softly, she said. "Most of them have been deemed wild dog attacks."

I gulped, remembering the towering wolflike creature that had bit me, and remained silent as the nurse changed the subject. "Your wound is healing remarkably fast. Staying in good shape must help with that."

At first, I thought the nurse was trying to be smart with me, and threw the covers off of me to give her a piece of my mind. Only I froze upon doing so, seeing that I somehow now had a lean and muscular frame. I looked like I was in better shape than Janelle Lee! "What...?!" was all I could say in my surprise.

"Is everything alright, dear?" Turning to me, the nurse asked.

I was confused, though somewhat happy. "I- I think I need to use the bathroom." Muttering, I said.

The nurse nodded, then aided me to the bathroom, though I felt as if I could now run a marathon without breaking a sweat. As I walked towards the bathroom, I stumbled slightly, as sounds and smells began to flood my mind. It was a bit overwhelming, it frightened me.

What is happening to me?

The sounds and smells and, later on, the sights continued to flood my mind, to the point I was tempted to ask for a sleeping pill. Somehow, I made it through the day, and watched as the sun began to set. Once I saw the moon in the night sky,...
12.title: The strangeness continues.

121.content:
Once I saw the moon in the night sky, I smelled someone with an expensive perfume in the hall. She was very close and with two people, each wearing a different brand of cologne. I turned to the door and jumped upon seeing the three people in black business suits from before. The woman with red hair smiled slightly.

"Tasha Lyall?" Calmly, she inquired.

"Y- Yes." Nervous, I replied.

"My name is Aoife." Calmly, the woman said. "These are my associates. Cain to my right, and Slade to my left." The two men nodded silently as they were introduced.

"What do you want from me?" I asked.

"We are here to help you understand what had happened to you," Aoife replied, "and what will be happening in the following weeks."

"Are you guys from the government?" Shuddering, I demanded. "Covering up some sick experiment that got loose?"

The two men frowned and slightly shook their heads, but did not speak. "What attacked you last night is called a werewolf, colleen." Serious, Aoife explained. "Before you scoff, note that your thirty pounds of fat have become thirty pounds of sheer muscle. That you can smell what everyone on this floor is having for their meals. That you can see a small crow on the water tower on the horizon."

"I get the picture." Tearing up, I said. "I take it I've been turned into one?"
