Aoife nodded. "Yes, though that was not the intent." Softly, she replied. "Your fast thinking with the pepper spray may have spared you from a grim demise, but it has cursed you with a more grueling fate."

"We are what you might call a cleaning crew." Speaking for the first time, Cain said. "We clean up the messes left by werewolves, so to maintain the Masquerade that they do not exist."

"So what now?" Frowning, I demanded. "Are you going to finish me off?"

Aoife sighed. "I understand your fears, colleen." Calmly, she said. "However, you must control your emotions. You are changing rapidly, from the inside, and it will wreak havoc upon your mind."

"You will be released from the hospital tomorrow morning with a clean bill of health." Serious, Slade added. "However, the life you knew is over, and a new one is about to begin."

I was literally trembling at this point. "Why are you telling me all of this?"

"Because, colleen, we know what you are going through." Calmly, Aoife replied. "We have seen it happen again and again over the centuries."

She then smiled, revealing a pair of long, pearl-white fangs.
121.title: The three in black return.

choices: I am released from the hospital.
1211.content:
Seeing those two sharp fangs triggered something within me, and I leaped from the bed, away from her, onto the visitor's bed, before giving an angry growl. It was not until Aoife hid her fangs that I calmed down, and realized that I was in a crouched position, like some cheesy martial arts movie.

"As you can see, colleen, your instincts are far different than they were before." Calmly, Aoife said. "You leaped twenty feet in a single bound, and bared your fangs at the sight of a vampire."

I was both taken aback and afraid. "What?!"

I turned to the open bathroom door and spotted myself in the mirror. Although it was dark, I could see myself clearly. My ears had become more pointed and had moved closer to the top of my head, and all of my teeth had become sharp, much like a wolf.

I turned back to the three, terror in my eyes, only to see them slowly nod. "You are experiencing what we call a first stage." Serious, Cain explained. "Partial transformations that serve as a protective measure for those turned, until their first full moon."

"As you can see, it only lasts for as long as the werewolf feels threatened." Calmly, Slade added. "This is why you need to control your emotions."

I turned back to the mirror to find that I was back to normal again, which caused me to cry. "What am I going to do?" Sobbing, I asked. "I- I don't want to hurt anybody."

"That is why we are here, colleen." Calmly, Aoife said. "We will help you learn to control your newfound strengths and remain within human society."

Trembling, I slowly returned to the hospital bed. "I take it there is no cure for this."

Aoife shook her head. "If there were, our jobs would be easier." Softly, she said. "For now, just understand that we, and others like us, will be looking over you." She handed me a card. "If you have any problems or questions, call us."

With that said, the three quietly walked out of my hospital room and were gone.
1211.title: The talk continues.

12111.content:
Shortly after the three had left, I fell into a restless sleep. I dreamed that I was running free through a dark woods, chasing after a man in a suit of armor on a horse. I could sense others running with me, but my focus was on the man. I could smell the sweat on him and his horse, and I could sense their utter terror. It filled me with a strange sense of excitement as I pushed myself to run faster. I heard the man scream as I leaped upon him and drove my teeth into the soft flesh of his exposed neck. Blood gushed into my mouth, increasing my excitement, as I bit again and again, before letting out a haunting howl to the full moon...

I woke with a start, sweat pouring all over my body. I noticed that I was biting onto the metal bar of my bed. I began to shiver from both the chill of my sweat and fear of the nightmare, still very much fresh in my mind. The orderly from before entered my room, looking very much concerned. "Nightmare?" Softly, he asked.

I nodded. "It was... so real." Trembling, I said.

The orderly nodded before letting out a low sigh. "My name is Randall Woolsey." Calmly, he said. "We met that night of the full moon."

I gasped. "You're the one who attacked me!" Hoarsely, I said.

I scrambled for the nurse call button, only to be stopped by Randall's hand. He had a grip like a vise. "Listen and understand." Softly, he hissed. "I have to look after you until your first full moon, to save face in the family. Any lives lost due to you after your first transformation will be on me, unless I get you ready."

"Can you at least get me some dry clothes?" Frightened, I asked.

Randall nodded. "After you are changed, we will need to have a long talk before the doctors release you." Serious, he said. "I was sloppy that night... I'm sorry."

He handed me a towel and a fresh set of scrubs before turning around so I could change. "What did that woman do to deserve being eaten alive?" Worried, I asked.

"She was a reporter." Darkly, Randall replied. "She was hell bent upon exposing the existence of our kind to the world." He sighed. "All efforts were made to discreetly detour her, but she refused to relent. Taking her down was the last option."

"So I was just in the wrong place at the wrong time." Sadly, I said.

"Pretty much... " Sighing, Randall replied. "The job had been done by the time you came to investigate, but I was too hyped up from the hunt... As I said, I was sloppy."

"What's with the tequila?" Now dry and dressed, I asked. "I'm decent now, by the way."

Randall turned around, shrugging. "No better way to drown the blues after getting the riot act from my parents, the pack, and the cleaning crew." Softly, he said. "I'm certain another riot act will come from you and your parents, once the truth of what had happened to you comes out."

I sighed, uncertain how to react. "Well... what's done is done, and it can't be undone." Albeit reluctantly, I said. "All I can do is move on, so... what can you tell me of what to expect up to my first full moon?"

Randall sighed, a small grin appearing on his face. "Thank you."
12111.title: I have a dream.

121111.content:
Randall took a seat next to my bed, then paused to collect his thoughts. "The nightmare you experienced is just the beginning." Serious, he explained. "Your mind is struggling to understand what is happening to you. The nightmares are not only going to continue, but get worse, until your first full moon."

I shuddered at the thought. "I dreamed that I was part of a group hunting a man on horseback in medieval armor." Softly, I said. "I bit into his neck again and again, then howled at the full moon."

"I'm not an expert in dreams, Tasha." Calmly, Randall said. "However, I can tell you that the nightmares will end after your first full moon. From there, you will start your new life as a werewolf and a part of the pack."

"What do you mean?" wincing, I asked.

Randall blushed slightly. "Well,... I sort of like you." Softly, he said. "I was devastated when I realized I had bit you in the heat of the moment,... " His voice trailed off. "But... you probably hate me right now."

Another surprise. I had no idea that Randall Woolsey liked me, or even knew I existed. I was again uncertain of how to respond. All I could think to say was, "You never know what the future might bring."

Randall turned to me, surprised, then smiled more, seeing me blush. "You never know."

We exchanged a shy smile, but I changed the subject before things got too awkward. "Um... Am I a member of the undead?"

"Humans refer to us as the undead." Calmly, Randall replied. "They fear what they do not understand, and oftentimes hunt it down."

"Then... what am I?" Uncertain, I asked.

"We are what we are." Shrugging, Randall replied. "Our bite does not change anyone, unless under the power of the full moon, or something like that. I'm not a doctor either."

I giggled at that. "What are you, then?" Grinning, I asked.

Randall sighed. "I'm a hunter in training." Softly, he said. "The reporter was my first ordered slay, and perhaps my last."

I sighed myself. "I forgive you, Randall Woolsey." Looking him in the eye, I said. "Do you forgive me for the pepper spray?"

Randall chuckled. "I was blinded for a good ten minutes due to your move, but... it was self defense, so, yeah, I forgive you."

"What else should I expect?" Calmly, I asked.

"You are going to get leaner and stronger as you get closer to the next full moon." Serious, Randall said. "You are going to need a safe place to lock yourself up during your first transformation, to protect yourself and those around you."

"Can you help me with that?" Curious, I asked.

Randall nodded. "My family can. They will be meeting with your parents tomorrow."

I was about to say something, but paused, as I smelled Mom's perfume and heard Dad's heavy footsteps approaching. Randall heard them as well, and walked out as they walked in.
121111.title: Randall and I talk.

choices: I am released from the hospital.
1211111.content:
I was a little disappointed when Randall left as my parents walked in, but I smiled in greeting as they sat down next to me. "How are you feeling, honey?" Worried, Mom asked. "You've lost so much weight in just a short time, and you are so pale,... "

"I'm still recovering, I think, Mom." Wincing, I replied. "I have lost a lot of weight, but, for some reason, I feel great."

"You're not just telling us this, are you, pumpkin?" Worried, Dad asked. "I know the hospital food is not exactly gourmet."

I giggled at that. "No, I seriously feel great." forcing a smile, I said. "Look at where I got bit, it's almost all the way healed already."

"That deep of a bite?" Surprised, Mom asked. she frowned. "Tasha, that bite nearly dislocated your shoulder."

"There are no wild dogs anywhere that can do that with a single bite." Serious, Dad said. "It had to have been a wolf." He sighed. "I have posted a warning on social media to be on the look out for a wolf pack in the area."

I pulled down the side of my gown, and showed Dad the stitched up would. It was nearly completely healed, with only a bruise here or there. "See... it healed up real fast, though I really can't explain it." I gulped at the end.

Dad gave me a curious look, then turned to Mom, who then walked to the door and quietly closed it. As she walked back to me, she softly demanded. "Tell us what you know, or what you think you know."

Again, I gulped. I could not help it. Every time I was holding something back, I would gulp as if swallowing the guilt of not sharing something. "Four strange people came to see me just as the sun went down." Softly, I explained. "One woman and two men, claiming to be the cleaning crew."

I told Mom and Dad everything that the three had told me, then told them about Randall Woolsey, who claimed to have been the werewolf who had bit me. Mom and Dad were shocked, to say the least, though I doubted they believed me.

Then came another surprise as Dad began to pace the room, muttering to himself. Dad did this when he was upset, some form of method to calm himself down. Mom, however, ordered me to stand up and began to inspect me from head to toe. It quickly became unnerving.

"Um,... Mom?" Nervous, I said.

"In a minute, colleen." Sternly, Mom snapped.

I froze, hearing that. The woman, Aoife, called me that as well. Colleen... Irish for girl. Mom continue to inspect every part of my body before finally having me put back on the scrubs and sat down next to me. "Your father and I met in college." Softly, she explained. "We were both taking a minor in parapsychology, the study of the paranormal: ghosts,... vampires,... werewolves..."

"We were fascinated by them." Finally settling down, Dad said. "We often joked that one of us would end up becoming one or the other." He gulped, tearing up. "We never dreamed it would happen to our only daughter."

"Randall Woolsey said that he would bring his parents to the house tomorrow night, to talk to you two." Nervous, I said. "They want me to be prepared for my first full moon."

Mom and Dad turned to each other, worried.
1211111.title: Talking to my parents.

12111111.content:
Early the following morning, as Aoife had said, it was announced that I would be discharged from the hospital. "I do not understand it, but your daughter has made a remarkably fast recovery." Calmly, the doctor said. "At my age, I do not question such things, I am only grateful my patients leave my care better than they came."

As I got dressed to go home, I looked in the mirror and immediately noticed that I had changed more overnight. I now had a narrow face, with sharp green eyes, elf-like pointed ears, and a dark nose, like that on a wolf. I raised my hands to touch my face, and found that I now had long, pointed fingernails. Upon touching my face, I discovered that I had almost clear-colored peach fuzz on my face. In fact, it was all over my body. There was no more denying it. I was indeed a werewolf.

I came out of the bathroom, wearing a simple dress and flats, to receive a hug from both Mom and Dad before a nurse came with a wheelchair. Sighing, I sat in the chair and allowed myself to be wheeled out to the car. It was not until we were well on our way out when Dad spoke. "I called the Woolsey family." serious, he said. "We are going to them and sort this all out here and now."

"Do you think that's wise?" Wincing, I asked.

Dad shook his head. "Our house is not exactly defensible." Softly, he said. "However, the Woolsey family is well known and respected in the area. They will not do anything foolish, especially not since they are holding a public event tonight at their mansion."

"We were given an invitation to attend, so we can talk everything over in one of their private offices." Calmly, Mom added. "Don't worry, honey, everything will be fine."

I forced another smile, though I did not feel as confident. Perhaps I was just frightened, but not for myself, for my mom and dad.
12111111.title: I am released from the hospital.

121111111.content:
Mom and Dad drove me out of town, towards what many had dubbed the Midnight Forest. It was over one hundred acres of dense forest land that, once you were in it, made noon look like twilight. At the edge of the forest was the Woolsey estate. It looked much like a fortress that had been converted into a mansion. Looking upon it all, I had the urge to run out into the forest... to hunt. "This place is incredible." Smiling, I said. "How do they even afford it all?"

"Werewolves age far more slowly than humans." Calmly, Dad explained. "Truebloods age even more slowly, so they can acquire vast fortunes in their lifetime."

We pulled up to the main house. Once we stepped out, a valet took the car to be parked elsewhere, while a tall, attractive woman walked out to greet us. With her were two people I recognized, Brad Butler and Colin Channing. "Fancy meeting you two here." Surprised, I said.

"Likewise." Nodding, Colin said.

"Professor Woolsey... " Bowing, Dad said. "It's an honor to meet you again."

I watched, taken aback, as Dad, then Mom, kissed her hand. "The honor is mine." Smiling back, the woman said. "Though, please, call me Susi." She turned to me. "You must be Tasha... my son has said so much about you."

"All good, I hope." forcing a smile, I said.

Susi giggled. "Do not hide your emotions, child." Calmly, she said. "We werewolves can sense your emotions before you even show them. It is natural to be nervous."

"Are they werewolves too?" Motioning to Colin and Brad, I asked.

"They are Lycan thralls." Patiently, Susi replied. "They work for our family in exchange for protection or political favor." She smiled. "Why don't we take this conversation inside where we can be more comfortable."

Susi led us inside the mansion, where Colin and Brad took our coats before leaving us, while Susi invited us into a grand dining hall. "The public event is not for several hours, but I find conversations go far more smoothly over a meal."

Brad and Collin returned and helped us into chairs, while Susi seated herself before taking a moment to collect her thoughts. "First, I taught the Parapsychology class your parents minored in during their college years." Serious, she began. "They actually tied for best student couple with two others. Before you ask, no, they had no idea I was a werewolf until they contacted me."

"I was told that everything of who and what I am would be explained." Wincing, I said.

Susi nodded. "Those who become Lycan thralls are sometimes inducted into the pack, though Bradley is disqualified, for reasons I will not discuss." Calmly, she said. "Those who are bitten, for whatever reason, and survive are automatically inducted into the pack, to preserve the Masquerade. This includes you, which brings us to The Talk."

I gulped. "I have a feeling it's a bit different from The Talk Mom gave me."

Susi smiled. "First, you can get pregnant, but you will never acquire any STDs, outside of being a carrier for about twenty four hours, the time needed for your new enhanced immune system to eradicate it." She turned to Mom, a bemused look on her face.

Mom cleared her throat. "If you become pregnant by another werewolf, you will carry the child for three months, whereas I carried you for nine." Blushing, she said. "If you mate with a human, your child will most likely be human, but it may be a viewolf."

"A what?!" Wincing, I asked.

"A human/werewolf hybrid." Softly, Dad explained. "Pregnancy with a viewolf has the same three month gestation period. Only, if a human were to mate a werewolf, her pregnancy would be problematic."

"Upon or shortly after birth, the viewolf can and has killed their human mother, due to the fact they can shapeshift at will." Serious, Susi said. "As such, they are treated as the pack Omega. They must prove themselves worthy in all aspects of life within the pack, and only a select few have."

"Then I guess it would be in the best interest of my child to have a werewolf father." Disappointed, I said. "I see."

"It is not personal, child." Calmly, Susi said. "It is simply the life of a werewolf."

"I can see that all of your teachings were the truth and not legend." Pale, Dad said.

Susi smiled. "The truth is often stranger than fiction."
121111111.title: Meeting the Woolsey family.

1211111111.content:
"Pardon the intrusion, mistress." Politely, a middle aged man said. "The meal you had ordered is ready to be served."

"Very well, Lupus." Calmly, Susi said. "We are ready to be served."

The butler, Lupus, nodded, then motioned Colin and Brad to serve the guests. Colin served me first, which Susi definitely noticed, as she flashed me a knowing smile, before silently nodding at him as he served her, blushing. Once all of the covered dishes were served, Brad poured everyone what looked like a fine red wine. I nearly jumped when I smelled blood. I turned to Susi, who smiled.

"These are Bloody Marys, a reinvented cocktail classic, featuring citrine-colored pig's blood consommé and Tito's vodka." Calmly, she explained. "Pig's blood is a touch more fragrant to the nose than the pungent tomato sauce from the original recipe." She gave a light giggle. "However, for you, we have provided a vegetable juice, as you are a bit too young for alcohol."

I gulped, then turned to the covered dish in front of me. I was a bit relieved when it was revealed to be a fine slice of venison, though rare. "I have a lot to get used to." Softly, I said. "I was a strict vegetarian."

"Oh?" Bemused, Susi inquired. "Try the vegetable juice."

I paused, not knowing what to expect, and took a cautious sip. I immediately regretted it, and turned to find Colin holding up a bucket, into which I spit out the juice before the drink was taken away. "What... ?" Confused, I asked.

Susi giggled again. "Werewolves, like regular wolves, prefer everything from nature, not processed from a store, which is one of the many things you will need to get used to, Tasha." Calmly, she said. She paused as Colin then placed a different red drink in front of me. "This should be more agreeable to your palate."

Curious, I lifted the glass and sniffed the drink. It smelled fantastic, and I took a sip. It tasted even better, and, before I knew it, I had drunk it all down. "That was amazing!"

"That was freshly squeezed fruit and vegetable juice." Bemused, Susi replied. "Anything processed, you will immediately reject. It is a natural survival instinct." She motioned to the meal in front of us. "Please, enjoy."

Mom and Dad began to eat in small bites, taking sips of their Bloody Marys, turning a worried eye to me occasionally as I reluctantly picked up the fork and knife. All the while, Susi watched me with increasing bemusement as I took my first bite. To both my surprise and delight, it was the greatest thing I had ever tasted! Before I could stop myself, I had dropped the fork and knife and was tearing into the venison as if i was tearing it off the carcass of a freshly killed deer. "Tasha!" Mortified, Mom gasped.

Susi raised her hand, silencing Mom. "It's perfectly normal." Kindly, she said. "Her first transformation is going to require an insane amount of calories, which she seriously lacks, which is why I invited you all to a meal."

I had finished the large slice of venison that had been offered to me, and turned to Susi as if to beg for more. "I- I can't believe I just ate meat." Blushing, I said. "I'm even more surprised that I'm still hungry."

"I'm not." Bemused, Susi said. "You are going through a lot of changes at a rapid pace, and need the nutrients to fuel them." She snapped her fingers, and Colin brought forth another plate of venison. "By all means, Tasha, eat your fill."
1211111111.title: Our meal is served.

12111111111.content:
After a robust meal, Susi escorted my family and me around the estate. "We cater to the werewolf community through a members- and invitation-only restaurant called The Gentleman Wolf." Calmly, Susi said. "It has just recently earned its third Michelin star."

"That is incredible." Smiling, I said. "I've always wanted to be a chef."

Susi smiled. "I'll pull a few strings, and see if I can get you in as a waitress." Bemused, she said. "From there, you can work your way up into being a chef."

We were then taken to the cellar, where we found several steel doors that led into spacious cells, with a shower, a large pile of hay, and a large pile of blankets. There was a window, but it was a good fifteen feet up, and had thick metal bars in it. "I take it this is where you go when you transform." Gulping, I said.

Susi nodded. "We have more than enough cells to accommodate every last member and guest of the mansion." Serious, she explained. "This is where you will be staying for your first full moon tomorrow night." She motioned to a trunk in one corner. "That will be where you will lock up your belongings, so you have something to wear come morning."

"You mean, we're staying here for the weekend?" Curious, Matt asked.

"Does that frighten you, pup?" Smiling, Susi asked.

Matt shrugged. "I dunno... " Nonchalant, he replied. "I haven't been attacked by one."

Susi giggled. "Your innocence is refreshing."

She roughed up his hair, causing him to chuckle before she turned to me. "How is your relationship with your cat, Clawdette?"

"How did you... ?" Surprised, I began.

Susi motioned to Mom and Dad, and I sighed, knowing they must have already talked about everything at length. "She avoids me. I mean she completely avoids me. I have not seen hide nor hair of her since I got back from the hospital."

Susi nodded. "She will come around in a few days." Calmly, she said. "I have a pet cat as well, we call her Shadow."

As we came back up from the cellar, I saw a large black cat approaching us in the hall who walked straight up to Susi and began to rub her body against her leg in a form of greeting, then moved on and the tour continued. "I'm surprised she didn't hiss at me." Wincing, I said. "Is she just used to werewolves around?"

Susi nodded. "Give Clawdette time." Smiling, she said. "Cats are sociable creatures. She will get to know the new you, and learn to love it."

Our tour ended with our guest bedchambers, where Dad and Matt found tuxedos waiting for them, and Mom and I found elegant dresses waiting for us. "The social event begins in three hours." Serious, Susi said. "Please be ready."

With that, we were left to our rooms.
12111111111.title: After the meal, a tour.

choices: My first night as a werewolf.
121111111111.content:
That night, Dad and Matt were in their dashing tuxedos, leading Mom and me in our elaborate dresses past two doors. They were opened for us by Collin and Brian, in old century servant uniforms. Beyond them, inside the spacious ballroom, we all saw a large number of men and women dancing together. Moving among them were all sorts of entertainers including jugglers, acrobatic dancers, violin players, and singers. It was a classic early century theme. Randall approached me, wearing an insanely expensive looking suit, and bowed before me. "May I have this dance, milady?" smiling, he asked.

"I'd be honored." Smiling back, I said.

Randall kissed my hand, like the gentlemen of old, and escorted me to the dance floor. Mom and Dad were not too far behind, leaving Matt alone like a small male wallflower. Only I gave a bemused smile as a girl Matt's age approached him and did a curtsy. "Would you care to take me to the dance floor, noble gentleman?" Smiling, she asked.

Matt blushed, looking a bit awkward. "I'm hardly a gentleman." Blushing, he said. "Besides, I'm not that good at dancing."

The girl giggled then grabbed Matt's hand. "Shut up and dance with me."

Matt blushed even more, but smiled as the girl pulled him out onto the dance floor. I could not help laugh, seeing Matt like putty in a strange girl's hands. Randall chuckled as well, then turned to me. "Her name is Luna. My mother adopted her last year." Softly, he explained. "She is a Lupine, a naturally born werewolf."

"What happened to her parents?" Worried, I asked.

Randall sighed. "Her parents were killed by an unknown monster hunter." Sadly, he replied. "Luna does not know who it was. She spent weeks in the midnight forest, alone, before Mom found her, just after her first full moon."

"That had to have been terrifying for her." Wincing, I said.

Randall nodded. "She has come a long way since then." Smiling, he said. "I'm actually surprised she went right up to Matt. She's normally so shy." He chuckled. "Do you think your little brother can handle her?"

I grinned. "Matt,... He's a wild child."

"A... what?" confused, Randall asked.

I giggled. "Matt was adopted too." Whispering, I said. "We found him in the mountain wilderness two years ago, running with the wolves." I sighed, a sad look forming on my face. "For some strange reason, he only listened to Mom, Dad, and me, so we were given the right to adopt him."

"Such a strange coincidence." Smiling, Randall said. "It's a small wonder the two hit it off so smoothly." He paused. "Do you think he might... ?"

"I don't know." Wincing, I replied. "He does not smell like... I do."

Randall winced. "Those naturally born have the same scent as humans, until their first transformation. It's a protective measure." Worried, he said. "I will inform Mom of this, and see what she thinks."

With that, the dancing continued, with entertainers moving among us, until the song ended, and everyone applauded the band, who bowed. Everyone fell silent as Susi raised her hand for attention. "Welcome, all, to the Hunter's Moon Ball." Calmly, she said. "We only have one new member this year... "

"If I may, Mother." suddenly, Randall announced. "We may have two new members."

Susi raised a single eyebrow, then gave a bemused smile, as Luna pulled Matt forward to be seen by all. "Can I keep him?" Beaming, she asked.

The guests roared into laughter, with Mom and Dad joining, though nervously. Susi gave a bemused smile and approached Matt before lifting his chin with one hand, and used a finger to push down his lip to look at his teeth. After a moment, she giggled, then winked at the guests. "Two new members."

Again, the guests laughed, then applauded as Susi then said, "Please welcome to our pack, Tasha and Matt Lyall!"

I gave a curtsy and Matt bowed, as the guests cheered and applauded.

After the party, all of the guests moved down to the cellar, where the men and women entered their own cells as the thralls closed and locked the heavy doors. "Do I have to go in one of those?" Worried, Matt asked.

Luna nodded. "It's not so bad." Cooing, she said. "I was scared of it too, once."

"It's just a precaution." Calmly, Susi said. "We will know for certain once morning comes, and everyone is released."

Uncertain, Matt walked into one of the cells and the heavy door was closed and locked behind him. Sighing, I entered a cell of my own, and prepared myself for my first transformation under the full moon.
121111111111.title: The public event.

1211111111111.content:
Once locked inside the spacious cell, I struggled slightly to get out of the elaborate dress Susi had given me. Once I had it off, I folded it neatly and placed it into the trunk that was provided and found, to my relief, there were my old jeans and blouse, waiting for me to wear in the morning. As instructed, I locked all of my clothes into the trunk, and waited as the room slowly got dark with the setting sun.

At first, I felt nothing. Then, a strange feeling came over me in sharp waves of both pleasure and pain. Every part of my body felt as if it were on fire, but, at the same time, I felt surges of high energy and power. The pain was making me stronger and stronger. I began to scream, then laugh, then scream again.

What's happening to me?! Curious, and frightened, I thought. It's so strange.

I looked at my hands, and saw that the skin was literally bubbling, as if all of the muscles and bones were reshaping themselves into a different form. My fingernails hardened, then grew into something more like claws, as pads formed upon my palms. My light peach fuzz body hair darkened and became thicker. Within seconds, I was covered in a dark brown fur, and I was forced to scream again as the pain forced me onto all fours. Again, I laughed as the pleasurable pain moved to my face. I could feel my nose being pulled forward, as my senses began to pick up the scent of everyone in the other cells, and hear their own cries and laughter. Finally, the transformation was complete, and I rose onto my hind legs, giving out a loud joyous howl. It was joined by a chorus of other howls, including one that sounded strangely familiar.

I never felt so powerful, or so free, in my entire life! I wanted to jump about, to run through the wilderness,... to hunt. I looked around, and became enraged to find that there were no visible exits. But that mood instantly improved as I heard a door open, and saw a number of rabbits hop into the cell with me. Prey...

Capturing and devouring the first rabbit was all too easy, but the death cry of the first alerted the others that there was a threat among them, and they all scattered, rushing to find hiding places. There were plenty of places to hide among the hay, blankets, trunk, and little holes in the cell walls. This only made the hunt all the more satisfying, and I had caught and devoured them all. After such a satisfying meal, I wiped the blood clean from my face with my arm, and drank my fill from the bucket of cold water, before relieving myself in the hay and lying down in the blankets to sleep.
1211111111111.title: My first night as a werewolf.

12111111111111.content:
The following morning, I woke up feeling refreshed, but with an odd taste in my mouth. Realizing it was the taste of rabbit, I remembered my actions of the night before and quickly got dressed, wanting to brush my teeth. Once I was dressed, a firm knock came to the cell door and a small panel opened revealing Susi's face. Seeing that I was dressed, she smiled and opened the cell door. "How was your first experience?" Calmly, she asked. "Do you feel any different?"

"It's funny how you refer to it as an experience." Smiling slightly, I replied. "It was incredible, but also frightening. As for how I feel,... I can't explain it."

"Try." Smiling, Susi said.

"I feel stronger, more confident than before." After a thought, I said. "It's like nothing before this matters at all."

Susi nodded. "That is because your life before is over, and you are reborn into a new life as a werewolf." Calmly, she said. "Now, I'm certain you are worried about your little brother, Matt."

"Did he transform?" Wincing, I asked.

Susi nodded. "He did: only, when we released him, we were in for a cute surprise." Bemused, she said. "The pack has affectionately dubbed him Cub."

"What do you mean?" Curious, I demanded.

Susi giggled and pointed to the cell Matt was assigned. Curious, I looked in to find him petting the rabbits that were given to him. "He didn't eat them?"

"He played with them all night long, just as a wolf cub would." Smiling, she said. "That, of course, will change as he gets older."

Matt looked up at me and smiled. "Morning, sis." Happily, he said. "When's breakfast? I'm starving."

The members of the pack laughed. "I think we can find you something to satisfy both of your appetites, Cub." Grinning, Susi she said. "Luna will take you to the kitchen."

Matt smiled sheepishly as Luna took his hand. "Come on!" Smiling, she said. "I can smell them cooking eggs from here!"

Matt sniffed the air and moaned, his mouth watering. "I can also smell bacon, buttered toast, and apple pie,... "

I sighed, seeing Matt and Luna rush up the stairs, while Colin and Brian gathered the rabbits from Matt's cell. "I wonder why he's not as scared as I was." Worried, I said.

"Albeit briefly, he lived with wolves." Softly, Susi said. "It was just a matter of his mind returning to those times." She placed a reassuring hand onto my shoulder. "He will have an easier transition because of it." She sighed. "Luna was the same way until the last full moon. She now eats the rabbits, but she is a growing girl."

I giggled at that. "We are going to have to convert our basement to accommodate two werewolves now." Softly, I said. "I just hope Mom and Dad can take it."

"I have known your mother and father for years, Tasha." Smiling, Susi said. "All I will say is that, although they do not realize it, this pack owes them many favors."

After leaving the Woolsey estate and returning home, I found two familiar faces waiting for me: my friends from school, Elisabeth Brooks and Sarah Patterson.
12111111111111.title: The following morning.

121111111111111.content:
"Where have you been, Tasha?" Worried, Sarah scolded. "After that wolf attack, it's like you fell off the face of the planet."

"Also, what happened to you?" Wincing, Elisabeth demanded. "You look and smell like you've been on an all-or-nothing workout regimen."

I sighed. "I've... changed." Softly, I said. "It's a long story, and I will only tell it if you can swear to secrecy." I winced. "Matt is involved, too."

Sarah gasped. "He didn't run back to the wolves, did he?" Worried, she asked.

Again, I winced, making both of my friends worry more. "He did... " Whispering, Elisabeth gasped. "That's why you were attacked, they wanted their cub back, didn't they?"

"They aren't wolves... " Softly, I said.

Darkly curious, Susan and Elisabeth swore to secrecy, and I allowed them in, and offered them seats in the sitting room. "First, try to understand that I'm still me, and Matt is still my annoying little brother." Calmly, I said.

"Hey!" Annoyed, Matt protested.

Susan and Elisabeth giggled. With the ice broken, I told my friends all that had happened to me after the wolf attack. By the time I finished, they were wide-eyed, but, surprisingly, not afraid. They seemed more curious than before. "So... you were in the wrong place at the wrong time, got bit by a werewolf." Thoughtful, Susan said. "Only you survived, and, now, you are a werewolf, too."

"Matt was always a werewolf, but had just reached the age for his first transformation." also thoughtful, Elisabeth said. She sighed. "So, what do you eat when you,... um,... "

"Wolf out?" Ruefully, I asked.

Susan and Elisabeth nodded.

"I eat rabbits... don't ask, you'll only puke." I then smiled. "Matt just played with them, like a little wolf cub."

Matt blushed at that, while my friends again giggled. "Well, you look great, other than needing a major wax job and a shower." Smiling, Elisabeth said.

"Tried that, it just grows back the next day." Softly, I said. "Also, I did shower" I turned to Matt, who sighed and walked up the stairs.

"You can take the child out of the wild, but not the wild out of the child." Bemused, Susan said. "Anyway, what does this mean for you... for us?"

"No one can know of this, outside of this inner circle." Serious, I said. "There are very powerful forces bent upon keeping up the Masquerade that werewolves do not exist."

"I can imagine." Wincing, Elisabeth said. "Do you only eat meat now, or... "

"I can eat fruits and vegetables, but they have to be all natural, or I'll just puke them right back up." serious, I said. "When we change every full moon, Matt and I have to be locked up in a cell, or we will run wild, and no one will be safe."

"Can we still hang out?" Hopeful, Susan asked.

I smiled at that. "Of course!" Happy, I replied. I then sighed. "I just don't know how Matt's friends will react to him."

"He can hang out with us." Serious, Elisabeth said. "Annoying or not, he's always been fun to have around."

"Thanks guys." Tearing up, I said. "Your friendship means a lot to me."

We all shared a hug at that point.
121111111111111.title: catching up with my friends.

1211111111111112.content:
Shortly after Susan and Elisabeth left in good terms, I closed the door and turned to find myself facing Aoife and her associates, Cain and Slade. I jumped, a short scream escaping my lips. "How did you do that?!" Startled, I demanded.

Aoife smiled. "It takes years of practice, colleen." Calmly, she said. "You need to focus your senses, until smelling and hearing someone coming becomes second nature."

"What brings you to my home?" More calmly, I asked.

"We understand you are close friends with Janelle Lee from your school." Serious, Aoife said. "She is now a vampire."

"Janelle... a vampire?" Surprised, i asked. "What happened?"

"Just like you... wrong place at the wrong time." Calmly Aoife said. "It is rare for two to be close friends on the opposite sides of the coin. This is an diplomatic opportunity we dare not pass up, as it may not come along for another century, if ever."

"What are you talking about?" Wincing, I asked. "We're close friends, yes but we're hardly diplomats." I sighed. "I thought the two were mortal enemies."

"There was a war centuries ago, one that pulled the humans into the fray." Serious, Aoife said. "You know it as the Dark Ages." She sighed. "Now, we both honor an unsteady cease fire, to maintain the Masquerade and keep the human population out of our hair, so to speak."

"Only now you want to find a way towards an actual peace treaty." Thoughtful I said. "I have not seen Janelle since prom night... I would like to meet her again,... but I need to know what started it all, before we even start any kind of talks."

Aoife nodded. "To begin with, vampires had used werewolves as bodyguards, to protect them while they slept and provided places for them to be locked up during their full moon transformations." Calmly, she explained. "Only over the years, this mutually beneficial arrangement blurred, until vampires saw werewolves as nothing but their mindless servants."

"A mistake was made... something that enraged the werewolves." Quietly, I said.

"Dracula - yes, he exists - killed a female werewolf in front of her pack." Darkly, Finola said. "This angered the entire pack, and they attacked in force. As it was a full moon, Dracula was forced to fall back."

"I thought vampires were immortal." Confused, I said.

"That does not mean we do not feel pain, colleen." Serious, Aoife countered. "That, and a human can kill a vampire with the right tools, we are not invulnerable." She sighed. "Needless to say, Dracula slaughtered the entire pack out of anger. He meant to make them serve as an example not to cross vampires."

"Only it pissed off the werewolves instead." Guessing correctly, I said.

Aoife nodded. "Thus, the war began." Sadly, she said. "The very next full moon, the entire werewolf community slaughtered every last dhampir and thrall in a hundred mile radius of the castle, which was what dragged the human population into the fray."

"What are dhampirs?" confused, I asked.

"A dhampir is a human/vampire hybrid." Calmly, Aoife explained. "They can only become a vampire if they give in to bloodlust. Otherwise, they only have a nigh immortality, living up to four hundred years."

"Much like a werewolf." thoughtful I said.

Again, Aoife nodded. "The war lasted until the beginning of the Italian Renaissance, which was when Dracula and Lycaon, the first werewolf, reluctantly signed a cease fire agreement that began the Masquerade."

"Is this Lycaon still alive?" Wincing, I asked.

Aoife shook her head. "He died shortly after the cease fire was signed, a victim of the Van Helsing family." Softly, she said. Her face turned dark. "That is a very carefully guarded secret I am trusting you with, colleen. It does not take much to enrage the werewolf community."

I gulped at that and slowly nodded. "I will not repeat it."

"My sister and I will arrange the meeting." Calmly, Aoife said. "Until then."

With that, she and her two associates were gone, as if they had never been there. I could only shake my head. "I've got to learn that trick."
1211111111111112.title: A visit from Aoife.

12111111111111121.content:
The very next night, Matt and I were picked up by a tall, muscular man who happened to own a vintage car straight out of a gangster movie. "I'm Detective Mike Sutherland." Flatly, he said. "I work for Finola in the vampire cleaning crew." flatly, he said. "I am to escort you to the midnight forest for the meeting."

"Forgive me, but why isn't a werewolf thrall taking us?" Worried, I asked.

"Because a werewolf thrall is taking Janelle to the meeting." Serious, Mike replied. "It is an honorary gesture of trust. If something happens to one, the other suffers."

I gulped at that and silently nodded. Only a slight smile touched the corners of my mouth as Mike ran to the car. "This is so cool!" Excited, he said. "How fast does she go?!"

"Classified." Softly, Mike replied.

Matt pouted. "You're no fun."

Mike sighed. "The meeting will be brief, and there are a few rules I need to go over with you before you meet your friend."

Sighing, I got Matt into the car then got in myself as Mike took the driver's seat. Once we were underway, I asked, "What are the rules?"

"There are just three." Serious, Mike said. "No sudden moves, keep your voice level at all times, and whatever you do,... keep your hands out of your pockets."

"I sort of get the first two rules." Wincing, Matt said. "Why the third?"

"The distrust between werewolves and vampires is outrageous." Serious, Mike said. "That said, both sides are easily triggered."

Minutes later, we arrived just outside of the midnight forest, where Mike stopped the car and ushered us out. "This is as far as I am allowed to take you." Calmly, he said. "Aoife will escort you out back to here when the meeting is over."

I looked out at the forest and found Aoife and her associates waiting. "Come, colleen." Calmly, she said. "It is time to meet your friend."

I nodded, then allowed Matt and me to be escorted to a large cabin near the center of the wilderness, where the entire pack was waiting for us. "I have brought them." Flatly, Aoife said. "They are safe."

"So it would seem." In the same tone, Susi said. "We agreed to this meeting with a guarded optimism."

I sniffed the air and winced... another vampire had arrived. As if on cue, a woman who looked strikingly like Aoife walked into the dim light of the moon. "As have we, they are here." Calmly, she said. She turned to me. "Good evening, colleen. I am Finola, Aoife's twin sister... the detective works for me."

I heard a car door open, and got the whiff of another vampire before seeing Janelle appear out of the shadows. Casually, I stepped behind Susi. "Nervous, cub?" Softly, she asked. "Don't be... you have the power of the pack behind you."

Janelle and a boy I recognized as Brad from school entered the scene. Seeing them, Aoife frowned. "I had a feeling you would bring her here, buachaill." Flatly, she said.

"The pack was curious to know her, Aoife." In the same tone, Brad replied. "That, and they trust me..."

"Um... is everything okay?" Wincing, Janelle asked.

"Just setting up boundaries." Calmly, Brad said. "Both cleaning crews are very wary of vampires and werewolves meeting each other."

"It is for the best that both sides avoid each other, and do not trespass upon their occupied territories." Calmly, Aoife said.

"Agreed." Nodding, Brad said. "However, Janelle was invited, and you were informed of the meeting." He smiled. "Had you disapproved, Finola would have intercepted us."

"We do not disapprove." Calmly, Finola said. "We are, as you said, wary of this meeting... anything can go wrong."

Deciding someone had to break the ice, I timidly called out, "Janelle... ?"

Janelle turned in my direction as I stepped out behind Susi.

"Tasha." Nodding, Janelle replied. "You look well..."

"You look like death warmed over." Wincing, I said. "Sorry, but you smell worse."

"You get used to it." Wincing back, Janelle said.

Tasha and I slowly approached each other, then, in a surprise move, we fell into an embrace and cried onto each other's shoulders.

"When did this happen to you?" After we parted, Janelle asked.

"The prom." Softly, I explained. "Wrong place at the wrong time sort of thing. I saw a werewolf eating a woman, and got bit trying to get away from it." I blushed. "Turns out he has a crush on me. You?"

"After graduation... I went out to dance the night away and well, stumbled upon an underground rave." Softly, Janelle said. "I got feasted on by four vampires, and left for dead... long story short, I'm one, too, now." I shrugged. "I'm taking an apprenticeship to learn to be a private investigator, likely for the cleaning crew."

"I'll soon be starting as a waitress, and work my way up to being a chef." With a slight smile, I said. I sighed as Colin cleared his throat. "Janelle, this is the pack... when they learned of the meeting, they wanted to meet you."

One by one, the members of the pack, adults, teenagers and children walked up to Janelle and sniffed her before walking away into the darkness of the wilderness. The last one to sniff her was Matt. Janelle looked at him surprised. "Matt, you too?!"

Matt smiled. "Yup."

"To my side, cub." Bemused, Susi said.

Reluctantly, Matt walked to her as Randall walked up to Janelle and introduced himself. "As you are a friend to Tasha, we wanted to know your scent, so as not to confuse you for a trespasser or threat, should you decide to visit her." Calmly, he said.

"Just make certain you announce your visit before coming." Serious, Aoife warned. "Werewolves can be rather impulsive when surprised."

"As can vampires." Calmly, Randall said. "So be certain you announce your visits to Janelle in advance as well, Tasha."

Janelle and I both nodded, and Janelle was escorted back to Brian's car, while Matt and I were escorted back to Mike's car. He did not speak until we were well away from the forest. "It is rare for a vampire and werewolf to have a relationship." Softly, he said. "Do not be surprised or hurt if it does not last long."

"What do you mean?" Worried, i asked. "They want us to be diplomats."

"That's the idea." Serious, Mike replied. "Still, expect many werewolves to try to talk you out of ever seeing her again." He sighed. "I have no doubt many vampires will have the same in mind with Miss Lee."

"But... why?" Curious, Matt asked.

"You know there was a cease fire." Calmly, Mike said.

I then knew what Mike was trying to say. "There is no treaty,... not yet."

Mike nodded. "You and Miss Lee have a big job ahead of you."
12111111111111121.title: Meeting Janelle.

121111111111111211.content:
The following morning began with a usual hearty breakfast and then homeschooling for both Matt and me. Only this was of the laws and ways of the werewolf. First was the Oath of the Moon. It was not any kind of religion, but more of a code of honor:

The wolf and man must hunt.
The wolf and man must obey the calling of the moon.
The man and wolf must balance flesh with spirit.
The man and wolf must embrace beauty and beast.


There is a balance between the savage beast and the intellectual man or woman to create harmony within oneself. Without harmony, there would only be madness and chaos. We would only be mindless beasts...


I stopped reading. "That's deep." Whispering, I said. "In a way, humans are the same."

"Not quite, but close." Calmly, Dad said. "We must all beware the Id, the savage beast or demon or however you describe it, within us all." He sighed. "Werewolves have learned to embrace the beast and become balanced with it."

"Is it the same with vampires?" Curious, I asked.

Before Dad could respond, the doorbell rang and Matt rushed to answer. At the door were his two friends, Greg and Dusty Rune. The twins were Matt's age and height, with brown hair and brown eyes. Both wore blue jeans, T-shirt and sneakers. "Here you are, nature boy." Teasing, Greg said. "We thought you had run back to the wild, since we haven't seen hide nor hair of you in a while."

"Are you okay, man?" More concerned, Dusty asked. "You usually call us every day."

"Well... we've been through a lot lately." Rubbing one arm, Matt said. "That, and this little girl I met... "

Greg and Dusty turned to each other, then laughed, causing Matt to blush. "You have a crush?!" Amused, Greg asked. "Matt, you animal!"

Mom could not help but grin. "It's two girls, actually."

Greg and Dusty laughed even harder, as Matt and I shot her an irritated look. Mom merely shrugged as she grinned. "They're just crushes, boys."

"Who are they?" Stepping inside, Dusty demanded.

"Do we know them?" Anxious, Greg asked.

"You don't know the first girl." Calmly, I said. "She's a wild child, like Matt, and her parents are obsessively protective."

"They call me cub." Blushing, Matt said.

Dusty smiled. "Sounds like someone we know."

Mom sighed. "Touche."

"The other is my friend's little sister, Courtney Lee." Remaining calm, I said. "I think it's more of a good friendship than anything else."

"Careful there, Matt." Becoming serious, Greg warned. "Girls can be vicious when they think they have competition, even with crushes."

Then a young man came to the door and knocked. "I work for Uber." Politely, he said. "I am here to pick up Matt Lyall for a meeting with Luna Woolsey."

"We were not informed of this." Stepping up, Dad said. "Let me see the paperwork."

The man handed Dad some papers, which Dad looked over, then turned to Matt. "If anything happens, run to the forest." Darkly, he said. He then whispered, "Only a suicidal fool would follow you there."

Matt nodded, then turned to the Uber driver, who seemed slightly startled. "My family is a bit over-the-top protective." Wincing, he said.

"Lucky me." Sweating, the driver muttered.

With that, Matt was driven away.
121111111111111211.title: Matt's friends.

choices: A talk with Mom and Dad.
1211111111111112111.content:
Over an hour had passed since the Uber driver took Matt off to meet with Luna at the Woolsey residence, without any word from either. When the telephone rang, Dad sprung up to answer it, putting it on speakerphone. "Matt?" Anxious, he demanded.

"Matt is safe, Mr. Lyall." Calmly a familiar female voice replied. "I have arranged for a taxi to deliver him home."

"What... happened?!" Angry, Dad demanded. I jumped, hearing a growl in his voice. Is he a werewolf too...?

"Calm yourself, berserker." Sternly, Finola warned. "You and your wife possess attributes far superior to normal humans,... not vampires."

"Berserker...?" worried, I asked.

"You are of Old Norse heritage, colleen." More calmly, Finola explained. "A berserker is nothing more than an extraordinary human with peak strength, speed and endurance. When enraged, they become even stronger, almost invincible... by human standards." She paused then added, "That said, you are an unusually strong werewolf."

"Please, Finola... " Politely, Mom said. "What happened? We are worried sick."

"Two thralls on each side heard whispers of our diplomatic plan, and decided to take matters into their own hands." Cryptically, Finola replied. "Rest assured, they will be dealt with." She sighed. "Expect Mr Matt Lyall to be returned home safe and sound within the hour. Good evening."

With that, she ended the call. Dad growled under his breath. "At least he is safe."

I could only stand in silence as Susi's words echoed in my mind: "All I will say is that, although they do not realize it, this pack owes them many favors..."
1211111111111112111.title: A call from Finola.

12111111111111121111.content:
After the call with Finola, I turned to Mom and Dad, worried. "Why didn't you tell me?"

"Would you have believed us?" Flatly, Dad countered. "When we go, well, berserk, we do not remember what we do or where we go."

"We would wake up in the strangest places, most times with our clothing torn to shreds, which was what led us to believe we could be or become werewolves." Softly, Mom added. "In fact, I woke up one morning in your father's arms." She blushed. "We both called it our first date, as we had no other explanation for it to those who found us."

"We began to seriously study the paranormal, to better understand who and what we were, which, as you know, was how we first met." Calmly, Dad said. "Aoife and her sister, Finola, taught the class, and helped us realize that we were berserkers."

"We spent many years learning how to control the rage, and, when we felt we needed to let it out, we went into the midnight forest." With a slight grin, Mom said. "Although we do not remember those times, we do have dreams of knocking around a giant wolf or two in the forest at night."

"It's also how we were able to rescue Matt from the wild, and why he listened to us." Softly, Dad said. "And why we were not afraid when you became a werewolf... we are strong enough to keep up with both of you."

I gulped, which Mom noticed. "I know what you are thinking, honey." Cooing, she said. "Yes, they have offered us to join the pack, and that offer was given again the night of your first transformation."

"Did you... accept?" Worried, I asked.

Dad shook his head. "We told them only when the time was right." Cryptically, he said. "The Woolsey family understands its meaning."

"I don't." Wincing, I said.

"We have.. an arrangement with the pack." Darkly, Mom explained. "If we were to ever lose control and go full berserk, we would be added to the pack."

That had to be at least part of what those thralls were planning. shuddering, I thought. A family of berserker werewolves.

Just then, the door opened, and Matt stepped inside, as a yellow taxi drove off.
12111111111111121111.title: A talk with Mom and Dad.

121111111111111211111.content:
My next meeting with Janelle was arranged a few days later, in light of the incident that left my little brother and her little sister alone for a short while. Albeit against my better judgement, I took Matt along with me. We met at the old church ruins just outside of the city, which werewolves and vampires alike considered neutral ground. Any and all fighting between the two powers was strictly forbidden in such locations. The church ruins were a monument to a citywide fire disaster decades ago.

Upon meeting Janelle there, I spotted her little sister, Courtney, nervously standing at her side, just as Matt was beside me. "I see they made you bring your sibling along too." Flatly, I said. "I guess they are part of the team."

"I guess... " sighing, Janelle said.

Then we both said, in unison, "You won't believe what I learned about my family."

We paused then gave a nervous giggle. "You first." Nodding, Janelle said.

"My mom and dad are berserkers." Softly, I said. "Descendants of legendary Old Norse warriors, with insane speed, strength, and endurance. They have been offered to join the pack on more than one occasion, but will only do so if they lose control."

"That is deep." Surprised, Janelle said. "Berserkers were considered demons of war, incredibly skilled and dangerous warriors, associated with the god Odin."

I nodded. "Which makes me a berserker werewolf. I have to work on controlling my temper more than ever." I sighed. "Your turn."

"I learned that my mother is a psychic vampire, as in she feeds off of life energy of people, rather than blood." Quietly, Janelle said. "She is also the granddaughter of Dracula... The Dracula." She gulped. "I'm almost expecting Courtney and me to be offered to cross the threshold any day."

"That makes you his great-granddaughter." Gulping, I said. "That beats me."

Janelle shook her head. "I don't know about that." Honestly, Janelle said. "I'm related to the Alpha vampire, your powers are the work of two gods."

We both paused and turned to Matt and Courtney, who had been silent all this time, to find them awkwardly smiling at each other, giving an occasional shrug or giggle. "Do either of you two have anything to add to this?" Curtly, Janelle demanded.

Matt and Courtney jumped slightly, and said in unison, "We weren't doing anything."

"That is not what she asked." Calmly, I said. "Do you two have anything to add?"

"Well, he's cute,... for a werewolf." Blushing, Courtney said. "I would not mind having him as a friend."

Matt blushed. "She is pretty,... for a vampire." Scoffing his feet, countered. "Only, I already have a werewolf girl who likes me, and..."

Courtney responded with "I said friend, not boyfriend." She scoffed. "Typical boy."

Janelle and I giggled. "I don't think we have to worry about any love triangles here." Bemused, I said. "Courtney seems to just like my brother as a friend."

"Agreed." Smiling, Janelle said.

Unknown to us until later, Mom and Mrs. Lee had followed us. They were having a conversation of their own, downwind, until...
121111111111111211111.title: Next meeting with Janelle.

1211111111111112111111.content:
The meeting ended several minutes later, on good terms. I was relieved to know that Matt did not have an infatuation with Courtney Lee, but an innocent friendship. I was also pleased to know that vampires, as a whole, wanted better relations just as much as werewolves, as a whole. Only we both agreed to take the process slowly, not to leave a single stone left unturned. Grudges on both sides had to be resolved, mysterious deaths had to be solved, including the death of all but one of the Van Helsing family. As I was walking back to my car, provided by the pack, I met up with Aoife.

"I take it the meeting went well." Courtly, she said.

"It was a step in the right direction." Calmly, I replied. "It is not just the two powers that need to face negotiations, it is their thralls and allies as well." I sighed. "The incident involving my brother and her sister was a clear example."

"Any issues?" Curious, Aoife asked.

I smiled, shaking my head. "Matt just sees Courtney as a friend, nothing more." Calmly, I replied. I giggled. "I think he has eyes for a certain female werewolf."

Aoife smiled. "Does Courtney return Matt's friendship?"

"She does." Nodding, I replied. "Though she made it clear there is nothing romantic between the two."

"News of this will calm many nerves." Serious, Aoife said. "We do not need a love triangle complicating the peace effort." She then frowned. "You should know that your mother and Miss Lee's mother had followed you here."

"What?" I sighed, annoyed.

"We intervened before you could detect them, and had a word with them." Calmly, Aoife said. "I must ask you to show restraint, and understand that your father and her father alike are obsessively protective."

"At least they did not follow us." sighing again, I muttered.

Aoife grinned. "I think you both would have smelled their collective testosterone from a mile away, if they had."

I giggled at that.
1211111111111112111111.title: Finola and Aoife intervened.

12111111111111121111111.content:
Upon returning home, Dad gave me a guilty look, to which I gave a patient smile, which caught him off guard. "We are working towards including you and Mom in our talks." Calmly, I explained. "However, it is going to take time, please be patient."

"Is Matt okay?" Softly, Dad asked.

"Matt is fine. He only has eyes for Luna right now." Smiling, I replied.

Dad sighed. "That is a relief."

"I'm fine too, Dad, thank you." Grinning, I said.

"I know you are, honey." Grinning back, Dad said. "You have berserker blood in your veins, which means you can hold your own."

"I thought a berserker was no match for a vampire." Wincing, I said.

"Not in a prolonged fight, no." Serious, Mom replied. "Vampires do not tire; berserkers do, eventually. But even Finola and Aoife know that a werewolf, dhampir, or young vampire would be hard pressed to keep even one of us at bay."

"This is why we have a non-interference pact with the sisters." Calmly, Dad said. "So long as this family... the pack... is not directly attacked, we stay out of their business and disagreements with other packs or other humans."

"What we are trying to say is that, even though we have the power to fight, we are not a threat to the peace." Softly, Mom said. "All we want is to ensure your safety and well being... that is the way of the pack."

I sighed, then knotted my jaws in decision. "Okay... if I am going to do my job right, I need to know everything."

Mom nodded. "I'll make a pot of tea."

Dad picked up a phone. "I will call Mike Sutherland, he will be Finola's voice."
12111111111111121111111.title: Back at home.

121111111111111211111111.content:
Minutes after Dad called Aoife, Mr Sutherland arrived at the house, and Mom set up tea, coffee, and snacks before the meeting began. "The first thing you need to understand, Tasha, is that the peace between vampires and werewolves is very delicate." Serious, he began. "The peace process must be done slowly, carefully."

"I understand that much." Nodding, I said.

"What you don't understand is that, by not filling your parents in on these meetings, you are giving them reasons to ignore the non-interference pact." Frowning, Mike scolded. "The peace process is a three way street. Werewolves, vampires, and humans, namely the thralls of either power and your parents."

"I will keep that in mind." Frowning back, I said. "Any other rules I was not told of?"

"This was a spur-of-the-moment plan." More calmly, Mike said. "We're all really just making this up as we go along. Anything you want to try, okay through Aoife first."

"What can we do regarding talks between the two groups of thralls?" Curious, I asked.

"Your boyfriend, Colin, and Janelle's boyfriend, Brad, will be joining you on these peace talks, and will be masked as dates." Serious, Mike replied. "Your parents will be busy working with me, helping maintain the Masquerade."

"What of my friends?" Wincing, I asked.

Mike frowned. "Don't let them in too deep,... for their own good."

The meeting lasted about an hour, with Mike and me setting up boundaries for the peace talks, dates and times for the next meet, and rules regarding the involvement of friends, unless I wanted my own thralls. By the time Mike left, I was exhausted and ready for bed, when I got a face-time call from Sarah and Elisabeth.

"Hey, what are you doing on July 4th?" Curious, she asked.

"It's a full moon." Ruefully, I replied. "I'll be in my cell, feasting on rabbits."

"Want to do something fun before then?" Happily, Elisabeth asked in the background.

"What do you have in mind?" Curious, I asked.

"They're playing a new movie at the cinema." Calmly, Sarah suggested.

"There's also the summer festival going on." Smiling, Elisabeth said. "We can make it a girls night out either way."

"Not tonight, I'm exhausted." Sighing, I replied.

"How about the night before the fourth?" Shrugging, Susan asked. She smiled. "We can bring your annoying little brother along and maybe meet his crush."

I giggled at that. "Okay, it sounds like fun." Smiling, I said. "I'll see you guys then."

As I hung up, I wondered where we would be going.
121111111111111211111111.title: Family meeting.

1211111111111112111111112.content:
The carnival was held just outside of the midnight forest. It was a two-day affair that ended with the Fourth of July fireworks. Sarah, Elisabeth, and I went, taking Matt along. Mom and Dad had agreed to meet with Janelle's parents, in a diplomatic understanding between the two families. As far as I knew, it was being led by detective Mike Sutherland. We walked among the many vendors selling anything from carnival treats to town history souvenirs. Matt bought a stuffed werewolf with his allowance, and gave it to Luna, who was with her mother, Susi.

"For you," Blushing, he said.

Luna giggled, then gave Matt a kiss on the cheek. "That's for you."

We all giggled at the sight of the two skipping ahead, holding hands. "They make such a cute couple." Smiling, Susan asked.

"Puppy love?" Grinning, Elisabeth asked.

"More like a cub crush." Bemused, Susi said. She turned to me, and I nodded, knowing the question.

"They only know about Matt and me." Whispering carefully, I said. "They suspect Luna is one, too, but I have not told them either way."

Susi nodded. "It is best to only tell them what they need to know, when they need to know it." Calmly, she whispered back. "Lessons learned from painful experience."

With that said, we returned to enjoying the carnival, with its many rides and games. Matt and Luna especially enjoyed themselves, having a seat all to themselves on the Ferris Wheel, and Luna winning the largest stuffed animal in the dart throwing game. The look on the vendor's face was priceless. "For you," Giggling, Luna said.

Matt blushed, accepting the large stuffed bear, and gave Luna a kiss on the cheek. "That's for you." Smiling, he said.

I turned, hearing a giggle, and saw Janelle approaching with her sister, Courtney, and their friends, Mindy and Zooey. "Fancy meeting you all here." Smiling, Janelle said. "Are you enjoying the carnival?"

I nodded, though I could not help but giggle. "We are, but not as much as Matt and Luna."

Janelle smiled, seeing the two holding hands. She then laughed as Luna threw Courtney a look of warning, pulling Matt closer to her. "Mine!" Sharply, she barked.

Courtney laughed, raising both hands. "He's all yours, kid." Bemused, she said.

"We heard you and Matt are werewolves." Quietly, Mindy said. "Does it hurt when you, well,... change?"

"Yes and no." Wincing, I replied. "It hurts, but it's also a rush, like... sex."

"That's an interesting way to put it." Bemused, Susi said. "It's accurate, though."

"I have so many questions." Wide eyed, Zooey whispered.

"As do we." wincing, Sarah said.

"You four can meet somewhere privately and discuss it later." Serious, Susi said. "Just do not share what you know."

"We've been warned." Gulping, Mindy said. Zooey, Sarah, and Elisabeth nodded.

Susi nodded, satisfied. "For now, this is a time to enjoy ourselves." Smiling, she said. "Allow yourselves to be kids for a while: it is not a role you will have forever."

We all nodded, then turned our attention back onto the carnival, until we all heard a familiar howl from the midnight forest. At first, I was surprised, as the full moon was not due for another night. Then, I saw a large timber wolf at the edge of the forest with its pack behind it.

"There is nothing to be worried about." Calmly, Susi said. "The wolf pack never leaves the safety of the forest. They howl every night before the full moon, to remind our pack it is nearly time to lock ourselves up for the night."

"That's a relief." Smiling, Mindy said.

Then, Luna ran up, looking worried and frightened. "Mommy,... Matt ran off!" Tearfully, she said. "He went after the wolves!"

"What?!" Stunned, Sarah demanded.

"I will handle this." Firmly, Susi said. "The rest of you stay here and enjoy the carnival."

Knowing Matt might be in danger, I...
1211111111111112111111112.title: The carnival.

12111111111111121111111121.content:
Aoife answered on the second ring. "Talk."

"We have a situation at the carnival." Stressed, I said. "Matt seems to have run off after the wolf pack in the midnight forest."

"I will have Finola deal with it." Calmly, Aoife replied. "I am certain that Susi already has her thralls on the lookout."

"Is there anything I can do?" Worried, I asked.

"Just try to enjoy the carnival." Remaining calm, Aoife said. "The wolves are more scared of you than you might think."

Then I heard Dad's voice in the back ground. "Trouble at the carnival?"

Aoife replied, "A pack of timber wolves was spotted at the edge of the forest. Nothing to be alarmed about, and nothing the daughter of a berserker can't handle."

I heard Dad give a pride-filled grunt and smiled. "I will be spending the Fourth at the Woolsey estate." More calmly, I said. "My friends will be returning to their perspective homes."

"A wise decision, Tasha." Calmly, Aoife replied. "Your friends need to prove their worth before coming too close to the inner circle."

"I understand." Softly, I said.

"Good girl."

Upon ending the call, I turned to Susi, who gave me a sad shake of the head, knowing my question. "Matt is not with the timber wolf pack." Softly, she said. "A search is underway, but it will take time, and I cannot put the thralls in danger during the full moon."

"What are we going to do?" Worried, I asked.

"Aoife and Finola will take over tomorrow after sundown." Calmly, Susi replied. "The timber wolves may have lured Matt away from the carnival, but it is unclear what happened after he entered the forest."

I could only turn to the trees and worry.
12111111111111121111111121.title: called Aoife.

choices: Matt is taken to his parents.
121111111111111211111111212.content:
The morning of the Fourth came, with still no word from Matt or Aoife. I was becoming worried, and decided to call Mike Sutherland for an update. He answered on the fourth ring with a tired sigh. "We are doing all we can to find your brother before the moon rises tonight, Miss Lyall." Stress in his voice, he said. "Your parents are, for the moment, being kept busy and unaware."

"Why?" Worried, I asked. "They could help."

"We found traces of your brother's blood." Darkly, Mike said. "He's been hurt, and is likely stumbling around in a daze in the dark forest." He sighed. "If your overly protective parents discover this, it could end their non-interference agreement."

"Is there anything I can do?" Tearing up, I asked. "He's my brother."

"You can help by staying in the Woolsey estate." Serious, Mike replied. "If luck is with us, Matt stayed within the forest, and is simply licking his wounds somewhere."

The hours passed after that phone call, and it was soon sundown, with still no word. I was crying as I stepped into my cell, and howled in sadness as the transformation took hold. Only, to my surprise and delight, a distant howl responded. I howled again, and again the response came. The other werewolves joined my howls in a chorus to lead my little brother home. Luna was especially howling in her own cell, the rabbits being forgotten for the moment.

Unknown to all until later, Finola was helping to scour the dark forest for Matt when she heard his howl. Janelle was with her. "Use extreme caution, colleen." Whispering, she warned. "Werewolves lose nearly all of their cognitive thinking in wolf form."

Janelle gulped before nodding, then paused as a wolf standing on its hind legs jumped out from behind some bushes with a bark. Finola pushed Janelle behind her, but paused as a small red ball rolled towards her. She looked at the ball, then turned to Matt to find him on all fours, panting with an air of excitement. He gave another bark, ran in a circle, then barked again.

"He's acting just like a wolf cub." Smiling slightly, Janelle stated.

"Of course." Smiling, Finola said. "Being raised by wolves, his first transformation made him think much like one."

With a bemused smile, she picked up the ball and gave it a light toss. Matt gave a happy bark and chased after the ball before returning it. Upon doing so, Finola handed Matt what looked like a doggy treat, which Matt devoured. Shortly after, he was fast asleep in a little ball at Janelle's feet. "He's actually kind of cute like this." Calmly, Janelle said. "What do you think happened to him last night?"

"We determined that he fell into a ravine and hit his head." Calmly, Finola replied. She motioned to the goose egg on Matt's head. "He wandered around, dazed, then found himself here."

Janelle looked, then moaned. "We should have guessed."

It was the cabin where she and I had our first meeting.
121111111111111211111111212.title: The Fourth of July.

1211111111111112111111112121.content:
I was relieved to see Colin escorting Matt to me when I was released from my cell the following morning. I was also annoyed. "Why did you run off like that?!" Scolding, I demanded. "Don't you know you could have been hurt?!"

"Easy, Tasha." Firmly, Susi said. "Matt can't help himself. When the wolves beckon, he goes to them. They are his family, too."

"Where was he all this time?" More softly, I demanded.

"He fell into a shallow ravine and hit his head." Calmly, Colin explained. "Stunned, he wandered through the woods, until he found the cabin where you and Janelle had your first meeting." He gave a nervous chuckle. "None of us thought to look inside."

I sighed, then roughed up Matt's hair. "At least you are back and safe." Bemused, I said. "Just don't give us another scare like that, okay?"

Matt blushed. "I'll try."

Upon our return home, Mom and Dad nearly smothered Matt with hugs and kisses, before turning to me. I winced, expecting the riot act, only they hugged me as well. "Matt has a habit of sneaking out in the middle of the night to the call of the wolves." Ruefully, Mom said. "I sometimes swear there is berserker blood in his veins as well."

"It's our fault for not warning you of this, honey." Calmly, Dad said. "I'll give you a GPS tracker so you can find him faster next time."

"You chipped me?!" Startled, Matt demanded.

"It's harmless, honey." Cooing, Mom said. "That, and it's for your own protection."

"We know what you are thinking, and we already got the riot act from Aoife for not telling her of the chip." Serious, Dad said. "It is because of the distrust between the powers they were not informed, until the time came for them to know."

I sighed before nodding. "I... understand."

"You better not use that when I start dating!" Annoyed, Matt demanded.

I could not help laugh, then a thought came to me and I added, "Same here!"

Mom and Dad blushed, telling me that I was chipped as well. That was how mom found out where Janelle and I were meeting. With a chill, I thought. Then I said out loud, "I'm going to bed."
1211111111111112111111112121.title: Matt is returned to me.

12111111111111121111111121211.content:
Neither Matt nor I talked to Mom or Dad the entire day, we were just.... angry. It was one thing to have us chipped, but not to tell us,...

Both Mom and Dad gave us our space while I spent some time with Colin late in the afternoon. He didn't know Matt and I were chipped, either, and he understood my frustration.

"I'd be mad, too, if my parents did that to me." Comforting me, he said. "Still, you have to admit, they were there when you needed the help the most." He chuckled. "We also have a better idea why no one ever physically bullied you."

I could not help grin at that, now knowing my parents were berserkers. "Their parents must have told them the story of the biker gang."

Colin nodded. "Susi told me that story too." Softly, he said. "The pack sees them as one of their own." He touched my hand. "As of last night, they see me the same way."

I gasped, knowing what that meant, and Colin nodded before revealing a heavily bandaged arm. At first, a look of guilt fell upon my face. "I- I didn't even notice you were injured at first." softly, I said. "I was just so mad..."

Colin lifted my chin to look me in the eye. "I have no doubt that, now that I'm a werewolf, too, they will want to chip me, as well." Smiling, he said. "I'll happily do it for you."

I wrapped my arms around Colin and kissed him, before we made out in the back seat of his car, until the sun went down. In the afterglow, I laid on top of Colin, smiling. "Best talk ever." Whispering, I said.

Colin grinned. "Just wait until our first date."

Eventually, it came time for me to return home. I was feeling a lot better, and ready to talk to my parents again, but, upon reaching my house, I was in for a surprise. Matt was outside, being confronted by two boys from school. They seemed angry at him for some reason. Neither were talking, but Matt was trying to talk them down.

"I don't know why you two are so pissed, but we can talk this out." Backing away, Matt said. "I don't want to fight."

The first boy threw a fist, catching Matt in the jaw, which turned out to be a big mistake. Matt's eyes turned red, and he lunged onto the boy with an angry roar, before literally throwing him over the head of the second boy. He bounced off the grass, and ended up in a heap near a tree. The second boy threw a fist of his own, only Matt caught it, and I could hear the knuckles cracking as he began to squeeze it.

"That's enough, Matt!" Running up, I yelled. "You made your point!"

Colin pulled the boy away, while I pulled Matt away, screaming and kicking in anger. "He hit me, sis!" Screaming, he protested. "He deserves to be pummeled!"

"These guys were hypnotized." Serious, Colin said. "Look at this one's eyes... glazed over, not even focused."

"Who could have done this?" Worried, I demanded.

Colin sighed. "My guess,... a vampire."

Just then, Mom and Dad came out, shaking their heads. "I was afraid of this." Softly, dad said. "This is why we had you two chipped... in case you were attacked, or taken,... or worse."

"Where were you two when this was happening?!" Annoyed, I asked.

"Watching the entire time, honey." Firmly, Mom replied. "Matt is a true born werewolf, two normal boys are no match for him."

"Besides, he wasn't talking to us, so we gave you both your space." Serious, Dad added. "We understand your anger, but you also need to understand our reasons."

"Vampires have always been... problematic with our bloodline." Softly, Mom said. "It was just in recent years that we had reached a non-interference pact; but, still, trust takes time."
12111111111111121111111121211.title: That night.

121111111111111211111111212111.content:
Later that night, my cellphone rang, and I put it on speaker phone for my family to hear. "We have trouble, Janelle." Darkly, I said. "Two freaked-out hypnotized boys tried to jump my little brother."
