"Is he okay?" Worried, Janelle asked.

"Other than being annoyed, my brother is fine, but I can't say the same for the boys." Softly, I replied. "Being a true born werewolf, he mopped the floor with them."

I could almost see Janelle wince when she asked, "Did your parents get involved?"

"Colin and I had to intervene... it's the only reason those boys are still alive." Sighing, I said. "Do you know anything about this?"

"A trouble-making vampire named Abby Vamp bewitched them into causing you and your brother grief." Serious, Janelle explained. "It's a form of hypnotism vampires seem to have over humans."

"Why us?" Worried, I demanded.

"To distract the cleaning crew, so she could talk to me." Serious, Janelle replied. "She wanted to know why I was planning on declining the Dark Gift, since I was a direct descendant of you-know-who."

"How does that involve us?" Wincing, I asked.

"She said that there were many vampires who would see the Dark Gift forced upon your parents, to gain a foothold in their campaign to take Lycaon's throne." Janelle said. "She told me I needed to think about what is right for my own kind."

"Good luck with that one." Scoffing, Dad said.

I shook my head. "Anything else?"

"Abby seems to think you are destined to become the leader of the packs." Serious, Janelle replied. "She seems to also think that I can persuade you, control you, making vampires rulers of the world."

Now it was my turn to scoff. "Persuade and control you and I... Girl, she obviously does not know who she's messing with."

Janelle giggled at that. "Obviously."

"We will contact Aoife and get more information on this Abby Vamp." Serious, Mom said. "Thank you for informing us of this."

I hung up on good terms, then turned to Mom and Dad. "We have a little bit of extra news for you." Blushing, I said.

Dad's face hardened, making Colin visibly nervous. "Phrase your next set of words carefully, young man." Darkly, dad said.

Knowing what Dad was fearing, Colin sighed before letting out a chuckle. "I accepted the calling of the pack." Showing his bandaged arm, he said.

Dad's face softened considerably, and he pulled Colin into a hug that nearly knocked the wind out of him. "Welcome to the pack, my boy!" Heartily, he said. He laughed, roughing up his hair. "This calls for a family celebration!"

Colin coughed and gasped upon being released, and turned to me. I could only shrug. "Welcome to the family."
121111111111111211111111212111.title: Janelle calls.

choices: My first day on the job.
1211111111111112111111112121112.content:
Colin left on good terms near midnight, and Randall Woolsey came calling shortly after. He seemed disappointed that I had chosen Colin, but congratulated me all the same.

"What brings you here, Mr. Woolsey?" Calmly, Dad demanded.

"I came to inform your daughter that she got the waitress job at the Woolsey estate." Politely, Randall said. "Her first day is Monday of next week. My mother asked me to inform you that, if you do well, you will move up to to kitchen staff, where you can work your way into becoming a chef."

I hopped in place, giggling in excitement, clapping my hands, before giving Randall a hug that knocked the wind out of him. "Thank you!" Excited, I said. "That's great news!"

Dad chuckled as Randall gasped for breath after I had released him. "That's my girl." Proudly, he said. "A chip off the old block."

I blushed, realizing what I had inadvertently done. "Sorry." Wincing, I said.

Randall waved it off, though I could tell he was startled. As he calmly walked away, I could hear his quickened breath and his increased heart rate. Then I heard him whisper, "Now I know why I was given such a riot act: had she gone berserk, she would have killed me."

I teared up hearing that, and turned to Dad after he was gone, who slowly nodded. "Yes, had you been triggered into anger rather than fear, you would have all too easily torn him apart." Softly, he said. "Though it is unlikely you would have killed him, your mother and I forbade him to ever court you due to this mistake."

"You forbade him?" Taken aback, I asked.

Mom nodded. "It was forbid him or let the cleaning crew deal with him, and you can imagine what their solution would have been."

I gulped. "So, you saved him by forbidding him."

Dad nodded. "You can befriend him, if you so wish, but that is as far as it will go."

The day that followed was filled with interviews at the Woolsey estate and training for my new night job. Upon returning home, I felt pleased with myself and retired for bed in the afternoon.
1211111111111112111111112121112.title: Randal Woolsey visits.

12111111111111121111111121211121.content:
The following night, I woke up to Mom screaming angrily. "When I get my hands on him, I will make him grovel for putting me through such worry!" Enraged, she screamed.

"Calm yourself, Nina." Firmly but kindly, Aoife said. "Like your son, Matt, Henry is known to run off somewhere for hours on end."

Just as I entered the sitting room, Colin entered. "We found him." Sighing, he said. "He is roughhousing with Mr. Stephen Lee, outside of the Midnight Eye Club."

I raised an eyebrow, to which Aoife said, "It's a bar that exclusively serves vampires, kept off the beaten path for that reason." she shook her head. "I had better report this to Finola. No doubt Anita is worried for her husband, Stephen."

She made the call, then, upon hanging up, we were whisked away in a cloud of darkness, to appear in an alley, where Dad and Mr Lee were in what could only be seen as an all out brawl. Finola had already arrived, with Janelle and her family. who looked at the spectacle with equal surprise. Upon seeing us, Dad and Mr Lee stopped their brawl. They picked up a tall jug of a red liquid, toasted each other, then laughed heartily in a drunken manner.

Finola shook her head. "Some people never change."

"Henry!" angered, Mom yelled. "What on Earth are you doing?!"

"Nina....*HIC!* Join us!" In a drunken slur, Dad said. "We all need to let go here... *HIC!* and there!"

"Blood wine." Frowning, Mrs Lee muttered. "Stephen, really?!"

Mr Lee pouted, much like a little boy who just got caught with his hand in the cookie jar. "We're celebrating, Anita... *BURP!* Don't be mad... *BURP!*"

Janelle and I both winced, smelling the alcohol on their breath from over six feet away. "What are you celebrating, Dad?" Looking embarrassed Janelle demanded.

Mr Lee smiled, revealing two very sharp fangs. "I am now a vampire... *HIC!* just like your mother... *BURP!*

"A very drunk vampire." Frowning, Finola said. "The headache and vomit fits you will have trying to sleep come dawn will make the aftermaths of your college years pale in comparison."

"The same will be true for you, Mr Lyall." Firmly, Aoife scolded.

"It will be nothing compared to when I get a hold of him." Furious, Mom muttered.

"Likewise..." Angry, Mrs Lee said. She turned to Janelle. "I suggest you get some ear plugs. I am about to make your father wish he never bought heavy metal records."

Janelle silently shook her head, then turned to me. "I think this would be a good time for us to have another meeting." Calmly, she said.

"I agree." Nodding, I said.

I turned to Mom, who nodded. "I suggest you and Colin spend the day at the Woolsey estate." Eyeing her husband, she said.

"I'm certain Ina would love some company at the office." Calmly, Finola said. "Aoife and I can provide transport."

Mom nodded, then took Dad by the ear, causing him to wince and protest like a child. "Ow! Ow!... Nina...!"

"Don't Nina me, mister!" Angry, Mom ordered. "You want to roughhouse, I'll be more than happy to accommodate you!"

"I have a feeling the house is going to be a mess when I get back." Sighing, I muttered.

Colin smiled. "Would you have them any other way?" Whispering carefully, he asked.

I shook my head, returning his smile. "No."
12111111111111121111111121211121.title: Never make Mom berserker angry.

121111111111111211111111212111211.content:
Upon arriving at the Woolsey estate, I was taken to a dressing room, where I was given my uniform. It was a cute button front black dress with ruffled sleeves that stopped just short of the knees, with knee-high black stockings, a white apron covering the front, and black flats. "You will be wearing this at all times while on your shift." Serious, Susi said. "You will also be wearing this pin on the left side of your apron."

She handed me a pin with crossed axes and a skull with two sickle swords underneath. "What is this?" Curious, I asked.

"It is your family crest." Calmly, Susi explained. "When guests see that, they will think twice before getting too frisky with you." She then handed me a tag with my name on it. "You see, your parents are not just berserkers: they are the strongest who had ever lived in our long history."

I gulped, then nodded. "Should I get changed now?"

"You have five minutes." Firmly, she said. "You will then receive on the job training." She cracked a grin. "I can't wait to see the look on the faces of some of those 'wolves' when they see your pin."

I smiled at that and changed into my uniform.

Five minutes later, I was given a tray of food, and ordered to take it to table three, where a group of four boys were seated, laughing and talking among themselves. "It's about time, sweetheart!" Cocky, the first boy said. "We're starving over here!"

"Come in close, baby," Grinning, the second boy said. "I want to smell your perfume."

The third boy chuckled. "I wonder if her skin feels as soft as it looks."

I can now see why Susi insisted that I get 'on the job training'. Annoyed, I thought. Becoming werewolves has not changed some boys; they're still jerks!

I smiled slightly when the fourth boy looked my way and turned pale. "Um,... guys,..."

He saw my pin. Bemused, I thought. Good.

I began to place the plates in front of the boys, the reasonable one first, who politely thanked me. I merely nodded, then turned to the second man, who grabbed my arm and pulled me close. He sniffed me, grinning stupidly. "You smell nice." Softly, he said. "I just may allow you to be my escort to the next dance."

I frowned, then discretely turned to Susi. She was holding a goofy grin as if trying her best not to laugh out loud. Only she gave a short nod, and I turned back to the boy, just as the third boy grabbed my other arm. "Don't be shy." Grinning, he said. "We love breaking in the fresh meat around here."

My eyes narrowed. "Do you, now?" Coldly, I asked.

Before I could stop myself, I grabbed the boy by the collar and literally threw him across the room, out the door. The doorman, as if expecting it, opened the door as the boy flew through. "Have a good evening, sir." Grinning, he said.

I then turned my attention to the other boy, who finally took notice of my pin and turned pale himself. He immediately released me. "I apologize." Trembling, he squeaked.

"Enjoy your meal as if it were your last." Growling, I said. "I certainly hope you are... generous with your tips."

The three boys quickly nodded, and left immediately after finishing their meal, leaving me a five hundred dollar tip. Once they were gone, Susi finally laughed out loud. "Well played, Miss Lyall!" Applauding me, she said. "We have been trying to get those four to behave themselves for weeks now."

"Why don't you just ban them from the restaurant?" Confused, I asked.

"We do not turn away any werewolf, despite how despicable they may be." Calmly, Susi replied. "The clean up crew deals with them, should they fall too far out of line, but these four kept themselves just barely out of the danger zone."

"Until I became a waitress." Sighing, I said.

Susi nodded, obviously still amused. "Do not think poorly of me for doing that to you." Smiling, she said. "Your act tonight has earned you the respect of all of your peers, not to mention their admiration."

"That was incredible!" running up to me, another waitress said. "I'm Crystal Canine, those four nearly made me quit on my first day." She bowed to me. "If you need anything, do not hesitate to ask."

I smiled. "I could use a few more friends." Softly, I said. "Are you up to it?"

Crystal looked up at me in surprise, then smiled and eagerly nodded.
121111111111111211111111212111211.title: First night on the job.

1211111111111112111111112121112112.content:
"We are all responsible for the cleaning and maintenance of our uniforms." Beginning my training, Crystal said. "Naturally, we have to be respectful to our guests, but..." She cracked a grin. As we are all family, we are allowed to defend ourselves and our honor, if we feel threatened."

I smiled at that. "I just hope that guy I threw doesn't hold a grudge."

Crystal giggled. "He won't, if he's smart." Smiling, she said. "The waitresses are required to report all incidents, so to give their side of the story. We have cameras catching every moment that happens here, so everyone knows Jack was not a gentle-wolf."

I nodded to that. "What of nights of a full moon?"

"The Gentleman Wolf restaurant is closed during the three day period of the full moons." Serious, Crystal replied. "Only we are expected to be in uniform and ready to work the moment it reopens, for our hungry guests."

"Are the waitresses responsible for the rooms?" Worried, I asked.

"Only during times we are short-staffed." Shrugging, Crystal replied. "Even then, very few werewolves stay during the day, as they have lives of their own outside of the midnight forest."

"Do I report my tips?" curious, I asked.

"Only if you wish to brag about them." Grinning, Crystal said. "We sometimes have a contest as to whoever can gain the most on busy nights just before and after the the full moon transitions." She then pointed to the tables. "Each waitress needs to be very punctual when clearing the tables they are assigned. If another waitress is ordered to clean the table for you, she gets the tip."

I winced at that. "Sounds like there is some competition for tips."

Crystal sighed. "Some werewolves tip scraps, while others pay their weight in gold." Sadly, she said. "I sometimes barely scrape by."

"Anyone I should watch out for?" curious, I asked.

Crystal discretely pointed to a young woman just entering the dinning hall. "Her name is Loveta Howl... she's a well known bully to other waitresses." Softly, she explained. "Only with you on the staff, she may tread more carefully."

"I guess we are going to find out." Whispering, I said. "She's coming our way."

"What are you two doing just standing around?!" Rudely, she barked. "We still have guests to serve!"

"You have a lot of nerve to talk." Coldly, I snapped back. "All waitresses are to be here and ready to work precisely on time." I then grinned. "You lost a lot of tips tonight."

"I see you are new here." Frowning, Loveta hissed. "I come when I please, and, if you are smart, you will give me the tips I earned from my tables!"

I turned to Crystal. "You told me she was a bully. You didn't tell me she was stupid."

Loveta turned red, and was about to grab me by the collar, but stopped cold on seeing my family seal pin. I have to admit, it was satisfying to see the color drain from her face, knowing who and what I was.

I was about to speak when Susi walked up with a slight grin on her face. "Ah, Loveta,... I see you have met our newest waitress, Tasha Lyall." Calmly, she said. "She is working her way up to chef status."

"Charmed." Frowning, Loveta said.

"Likewise." My eyes narrowing, I replied. "I do hope you will be more punctual in the future, poor Crystal had to work double duty."

"I am aware of this, Tasha, thank you." Politely, Susi said. She then turned to Loveta. "This is the last time I see you coming in late, or taking tips you did not earn. Have I made myself clear?"

Loveta's frown deepened. "Yes, ma'am."

Susi returned Loveta's frown, then walked away. Once she was gone, Loveta turned to Crystal and me. "You couldn't just leave well enough alone, could you?!" Angry, she hissed. "Mark my words, I'll make you both pay for this!"

With that, she stormed off before putting on a fake smile for the customers. I knew I had made an enemy, but, from the grateful smiles of the other waitresses, I had a feeling that I was the only one brave enough to stand up to her.
1211111111111112111111112121112112.title: Crystal continues my training.

12111111111111121111111121211121121.content:
After my shift was over, Susi called me to her office. Upon entering, I saw Crystal sitting in a chair. She winced upon seeing me. This made me slightly nervous, and I took a seat next to her.

"I called you both in because of Loveta Howl." Calmly, Susi said. "She is the daughter of the current Beta, which means her family has a lot of clout in this region."

"With all due respect, that should not give her any right to steal tips." Frowning, I said.

"I agree." Nodding, Susi said. "I knew this was occurring, but I waited until someone came to the point where they were not going to tolerate any more."

"But why?" Worried, Crystal asked. "If you knew she was taking everyone's pay,..."

"All of your lost funds, everyone's funds, will be returned to them in one lump sum in a most satisfying way." Calmly, Susi said. "You see, Crystal, Loveta's parents asked the Alpha of the pack to humble her. Only having her work as a waitress here has thus far made very little progress."

"So she needs that extra kick to knock her down a peg." Catching on, I said. "Which, I am guessing, is where I come in, as I stood up to her."

"Who is the Alpha?" Curious, Crystal asked.

Susi smiled, giving us her answer. "Oh..."

Susi nodded. "Very few know of this, and it will remain that way, is that clear?" Serious, she demanded.

Crystal and I nodded, and she continued. "I want to set a little trap for Loveta, one that will give her that extra kick, as you put it."

"What do you have in mind?" Curious, I asked.

"Loveta seems to enjoy targeting Crystal more than others." Calmly, Susi said. "I want you to help Crystal gain the confidence needed to stand up to Loveta. This will no doubt infuriate her."

"Causing her to make a mistake."

Susi nodded. "It is forbidden to use one's rank in the pack just to get your way." Darkly, she said. "This is why I was pleased you did not point out your family seal pin."

Now I caught on to Susi's plan. "You are hoping Loveta will openly pull rank."

Susi smiled. "I am counting on it."
12111111111111121111111121211121121.title: Bully trap.

121111111111111211111111212111211211.content:
I walked out of the Gentleman Wolf restaurant with Crystal, who did not want to be alone after her incident with Loveta. "The first thing you need to understand is that anyone can climb the social ladder." Serious, I said. "I thought I was near the bottom before all this started. The key is confidence."

""I'm not a fan of violence." wincing, Crystal said.

I giggled. "It is usually those who do not favor violence who are the best fighters."

Crystal blushed at that, but paled as Loveta walked out from around a corner. "You owe me my tips, rookie!" Annoyed, she warned.

"We owe you nothing." Eyes narrowing, I countered. "Step aside."

Loveta raised her hand to strike me, but Crystal stood in the way. "I wouldn't..."

"Are you serious right now?" Scoffing, Loveta asked. "Compared to me, you are nothing but a mangy little dog!" With that, she slapped Crystal across the face.

She let out a short scream and stumbled back. That turned out to be a mistake, as something snapped... not in me, but in Crystal. Her eyes turned an eerie red color before she gave out a familiar roar. When I saw two fangs drop from her upper jaw, it hit me: Crystal was a Viewolf.

"Calm down, Crystal." In a forced calm, I said. "It's not worth it."

"You are a freak of nature, Crystal!" Taunting, Loveta said. "Your mother was so desperate for love, she'd make out with anyone." She grinned. "Even a vampire."

Crystal took a number of breaths to control herself, which was when I pushed her behind me. "I know what you are trying to do, Loveta, and it's a dangerous game." Coldly, I said. "We are leaving."

"I did not give you permission to leave." Darkly, Loveta said.

"We didn't ask." Calmly, I countered.

I urged Crystal to start walking, which was when Loveta raised her hand to strike, only she did not follow through. She instead stood there, fuming. After we were out of hearing range, Crystal asked, "What was she trying to do back there?"

"She was trying to get you to strike her." Serious, I explained. " As a Viewolf, you are seen as an Omega, having to prove yourself in all aspects of your life." I then smiled. "Only even an Omega can become the Alpha."

Crystal gave me a grateful smile. "Thanks."
121111111111111211111111212111211211.title: Crystal gets confidence training.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111.content:
The following night, Aoife arranged for her and me to be picked up by Janelle in her cab, for a ride and a talk. "Loveta Howl is a loose cannon." Darkly, Aoife said. "While the vampire community cannot do anything to stop her, the werewolf community can."

"Do you think she is a threat to the peace process?" Serious, I asked.

Aoife sighed. "She is an obstacle, slowing the process down." Serious, Aoife replied. "She believes that her family is next in line to become Alpha."

"Only they are not." Guessing correctly, Janelle said.

"Tasha's family is next in line, due to their son, Matt, and their status as berserker allies to the pack." Serious, Aoife said. "When she figures that out, Matt will become a target."

"Over my dead body!" Angry, I growled.

"Patience, colleen." Scolding, Aoife said. "I will be having a talk with Miss Loveta Howl and her parents shortly. We need you two to continue as you were, being friends, and making more in both communities."

"Speak of the devil." Softly, Janelle said.

I looked out the window and spotted Loveta in front of the Gentleman Wolf restaurant. "I guess she needs a ride home."

"Follow the normal rules." Serious, Aoife said. "I will have a word with her."

I stepped out and walked past Loveta, only she grabbed my arm. "You and I are going to have a talk." Threatening, she said.

"You are hurting me, Loveta." Annoyed, I growled.

"You and I are going to have a talk, colleen." Firmly, Aoife said to Loveta. "There is a short verse, written a long, long time ago, about a class of humans who vampires and werewolves alike have learned to give a wide berth, to avoid... complications."

She motioned to me, then recited the verse:

They were many times outnumbered, still they fought on.
Blood from their wounds seeped into the Earth, still they fought on.
Vultures waited for them to die, still they fought on.
Odin alone chose this day to bestow upon them the berserker rage.
Now men and women fueled by Gods rose from the ground, screaming like bloodthirsty animals.
Thus is the gift of absolute mortal power.
No blade or weapon could harm them.
They killed man and beast alike.
All who stood in their way died that night.
When it was done, they decreed, Hail the Gods of War.


"A biker gang learned this the hard way." Serious, Aoife added. "I suggest you think long and hard before provoking that kind of rage." She then turned to me. "Patience is all that stands between you and the animal within."

With that, she stepped back into the cab. "The office."

Janelle nodded, then drove off.

"What- What was that all about?" Shaken, Loveta asked.

I sighed, knowing I could not use my family status. "If you don't know, you should ask your parents."

I gave Loveta a cold glare, causing her to take a fearful step back, and I walked into the restaurant to start my shift.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111.title: Meeting Janelle again.

12111111111111121111111121211121121112.content:
Upon entering the Gentleman Wolf, I was greeted by Susi, who was accompanied by a tall, muscular man and a petite woman. "Tasha, this is Fang and Claudine Howl, Loveta's parents and the Beta wolves of the pack."

"It is an honor to meet the daughter of the berserkers." Bowing, the man, Fang said. "You live up to their reputation."

"Indeed you do." Bowing as well, Claudine said. "You are among the first to stand up to our spoiled daughter." She smiled. "Most fear her, due to her status, but you already know that is forbidden."

"Then why allow her to do it?" Wincing, I asked.

"As cruel as it may seem, our daughter must learn through experience that intimidation will only get her so far." Serious, Fang replied. "Everyone has their breaking point, and, through that, even the Omega can become the Alpha."

I sighed. "I was warned that patience is the only thing that stands between me and the animal within." Softly, I said. "I can only assume she meant my berserker blood."

Fang shook his head. "That refers to the Id." Surprising me, he said. "The savage mind and emotions we all evolved from, and can all too easily return to."

"Even humans must be wary of this." Serious, Claudine said. "As my husband said, we all have our breaking point. After that, we either fall or rise."

"Your berserker blood is not a rank, but a legacy." Calmly, Fang said. "We are both expecting someone to someday take Loveta down a peg or two." He smiled. "At first, we thought it would be Miss Canine, but our daughter seems to be now targeting you."

"Our only regret is we may not be there to see it happen." Smiling, Claudine said.

I could not believe what I was hearing. They wanted me to fight Loveta? I turned to Susi with a questioning look, to which she gave a patient smile. "The werewolf pack is savage in its ways, but those ways have a purpose." Calmly, she explained. "I did not become Alpha because of my good looks and charm."

"Although we are next in line at the moment, that can change in a heartbeat." Serious, Fang said. "If your parents become werewolves, they will become stronger than us all, and the next Alpha couple."

"So... what do you want me to do?" Worried, I asked.

Claudine sighed. "If our daughter goes too far, don't hold back." Darkly, she said. "She needs to learn that she has to constantly earn her status. In the wolf pack, nothing is given by coincidence of birth."

"Hence, using status to get your way is forbidden..." Whispering, I said.

"You may take tonight off, Tasha." Calmly, Susi said. "Please, think about that you have learned here, and apply it."

As I left the restaurant, I spotted Loveta Howl talking to a girl in the shadows. She was about a year older than Loveta, with shoulder-length red hair and deep green eyes. She wore a strange school uniform I did not recognize, with a cloak too big for her covering it. They ran off into the shadows upon noticing me.

"Who was that?" Curious, I wondered.

"She called herself Abby Vamp." Startling me, Matt said.

I spun around to see him coming out of the shadows. "What are you doing here?" Scolding, I demanded. "Mom and Dad will freak when they find out you sneaked out of the house again."

"I left a note." Defending himself, Matt said. "Anyway, Abby seems to think of Janelle as a rival. She and Loveta want to find out why you and she are hanging around each other and the cleaning crews so much."

"You heard all of that from where you were?" Surprised, I asked.

Matt nodded. "I sort of learned how to get close without being seen or smelled with the timber wolves." Smiling, he said. "They miss me sometimes."

I sighed. "I need to go somewhere to unwind and think about this." Wearily, I said.

Matt beamed. "I know of a place." Grabbing my arm, Matt said. "Come on, it's not far!"

Before I knew it, I was being pulled down the sidewalk, towards a small coffee shop named Nouri's.
12111111111111121111111121211121121112.title: I meet Loveta's parents.

121111111111111211111111212111211211121.content:
Matt opened the door to step inside, only I hesitated, smelling vampires. Before I could protest, however, he grabbed my arm and pulled me in. "Come on, they aren't going to bite you." Grinning, he said. "They have great coffee here."

"Something you should not be drinking at your age." Wincing, I said.

I then turned to the patrons and barista, who greeted me with hardened faces, sending a clear message they did not want me there. I was tempted to pulled Matt our for his own good, but he spoke out. "It's okay, this place used to be a church, so it's still holy ground."

"I can't argue with that logic." Smiling slightly a powerful man said. "Welcome, Miss Lyall."

"Th- thank you." Nervous, I said. "Matt told me this was where he went to relax and unwind after a long day."

"That it is." Nodding, the barista said. He turned to Matt. "Do you want the usual?"

Matt nodded. "Yes, please." He produced a number of bills, then added, "One for my sister, too, there's a lot of shenanigans afoot."

"Really?" Raising an eyebrow, another cabbie asked. "May we ask what sort?"

"Her rival and her rival are plotting something." Pointing to Janelle and me, Matt said. "Aoife has already been told, and she's not happy."

"It's a given that Abby Vamp is just using Loveta." Frowning, Janelle said.

"I agree." Frowning, I replied. "Only I have a feeling Loveta believes it's the other way around." She sighed. "I wish I knew what they were up to."

"I already told you." Irritated, Matt said. "They want to know why you and Janelle are always hanging around each other and the two cleaning crews." He huffed. "It's like they're jealous or something."

"You just may have it there, kid." Softly, the barista said. "The cleaning crew is among the highest ranking officials on either side. They may be thinking Miss Lyall and Janelle are trying to rise quickly in ranks."

"With both hungry for power, they would see it as a threat to their goals." Thoughtful, the powerful man said. He turned to Matt. "Good detective work, kid."

Matt blushed, then beamed as a steaming cup of what looked like coffee was put in front of him. He sniffed it first, then took a sip before grinning. "It's good, sis. Try it!"

The powerful man whispered something to Janelle before she turned to me as I took a sip, prepared to spit it right back out. Only, to my surprise, it was blood with a hint of coffee for flavor. What surprised me more was that I actually found it very tasty. As I swallowed it down, I found the texture very smooth. It's... delicious. Wide eyed, I thought. then I said, "I've never had... blood coffee before... It's got a unique flavor."

"Do you like it?" Bemused, the barista asked.

After a pause, I shrugged. "It's okay."

The cabbies smiled as one remarked, "You like it."

The cabbies then turned to normal conversations about life in general as cab drivers, careful not to reveal their names just yet. Before long, Matt and I left on good terms. "They're really a great bunch of guys." Assuring me, Matt said. "They are just slow to to warm up to outsiders."

I nodded, then thought, There just might be hope for peace yet.
121111111111111211111111212111211211121.title: At the coffee shop.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
Several days passed without incident, and the peace process was going better than most had expected. Janelle and I had managed to bring small numbers of thralls on both sides to stop by Nouri's for casual conversations. No secrets were shared, but it was clearly established that both sides had the same fears of rekindling the old war. No one wanted that to happen.

Matt and Luna had become quite the pair, running about like two wolves at play whenever they met. Fortunately, neither were ready to take their relationship any further just yet, but they did make a cute couple.

Colin and I had been dating while talking to the werewolf thralls, which made intimate moments more difficult, but it also kept Dad at bay, who was more than capable of putting the fear of God into any would-be suitor.

I looked up from my diary as Susi approached me. "It is time to ride out the full moon." Calmly, she said. "You should know that Loveta Howl has been on edge all night."

I sighed. "Meaning she is up to something." Frowning, I said. "I hope she doesn't do anything stupid."

"Likewise." nodding, Susi replied. "Loveta is a strong werewolf, but a denier of old world warnings, such as other monsters, monster hunters,... berserkers..."

I cracked a grin at that. Though I had never seen Mom or Dad in action, I knew Dad could hold his own against a vampire in drunken roughhousing. "With luck, she won't learn the hard way."

I put my diary into my backpack, then walked into my cell, with the door being closed and locked behind me. Only, as Susi walked away to lock herself away, I saw the large pile of hay shift, before Loveta emerged from underneath.

"Are you insane?!" Angered and concerned, I demanded. "You know we'll end up fighting when we transform!"

"I'm counting on it." Scowling, Loveta countered. "I will show this pack who the true Alpha is, by sending you running with your tail between your legs!"

I could only shake my head, a sense of sadness coming over me. "You fool." Softly, I said. "You allowed Abby Vamp to talk you into an act of madness."

The transformations began for both of us shortly after, and we howled in unison before facing each other with just enough rabbits for one to feed upon. Loveta made the first move, swiping at me with her claws. She dug deep into my flesh, causing me to howl in pain before I swiped back in anger. Again and again, we lunged at each other, with Loveta making ground in her offensive. For a moment, as I lay on the floor, I thought she might win, only something snapped within me and I remembered Aoife's warning:

Now men and women fueled by Gods rose from the ground, screaming like bloodthirsty animals.
Thus is the gift of absolute mortal power...


I rose from the stone floor with a roar of rage that shook the entire cell, to the point of loosening the mortar. Loveta gave a surprised yelp and barely dodged a blow that cracked the heavy stone wall of the cell we were sharing.

I did not notice the shielded window in the door opening, or the panicked voices of the thralls who had heard the sounds of combat. All I remembered was a steel plate falling over the barred window before a pungent gas filled the cell, just as I threw Loveta into the cell door, literally breaking the lock and throwing it off its hinges.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Behold... the berserker rage!

choices: Mom and Dad become the Alpha couple.
A talk with the Beta couple.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
I woke up slowly, feeling very stiff and sore, to sighs of relief as my eyes flickered open. I was lying on a loveseat in the sitting room of Susi's estate. Mom and Dad stood before me, with a mixture of concern and pride on their faces. Matt was in the background with Luna at his side, looking a bit frightened, yet impressed. I also spotted Colin close by, who carried a similar expression. "You gave us all quite the scare, not to mention one hell of a show last night." Lightly scolding, Susi said. "Loveta Howl will likely never challenge you again, once she recovers."

"Will she be okay?" Wincing, I asked.

"Werewolves have remarkable healing capabilities." Calmly, Susi replied. "Loveta will live, but I suspect she will be limping for quite some time." She sighed. "You literally broke her against the heavy reinforced steel door, throwing it completely out of its frame."

"That's my girl." Grinning, Dad said. "You are now officially a berserker."

"What you experienced last night was the trial of fire." More serious, Mom said. "It is much like a dhampir becoming a full fledged vampire through the burning of the blood. You have awakened."

I gulped at that. "How does this affect the peace process?" Worried, I asked.

"It doesn't, as you fall under the same non-interference treaty as your parents." Serious, Susi replied. "Even though you are a part of the pack, your main function is as our ambassador to the vampires, to hammer out a peace treaty."

"Am I to receive any punishment for my part in the fight?" Worried, I asked.

Mom and Dad smiled, then turned to Susi, who smiled as well. "Loveta was foolish to hide in your cell to confront you." Calmly, she said. "She got all that she deserved, and, as her parents had requested, you did not hold back."

Just then, Fang and Claudine entered, looking concerned.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Aftermath.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
"I hold no ill will towards your daughter, Mr and Mrs Howl." Calmly, I said upon seeing them. "A vampire named Abby Vamp was seen talking to her: she has a talent of hypnotizing people to her will."

"We suspect Loveta was manipulated into attacking Tasha, in an attempt to disrupt the peace process." Calmly, Dad said. "However, like all young people, she failed to heed warnings of old."

Fang and Claudine nodded, relief on their faces, as I added, "Loveta's sore body and wounded pride will serve as her punishment, unless Susi has something to add."

Susi smiled. "Loveta learned a harsh lesson today. Let us hope she will profit from it."

"Thank you for not killing our daughter." Softly, Claudine said. "I know that was on your mind during the fight."

I giggled, surprising her. "Actually, I was more worried about getting my meal of rabbits than fighting her." Smiling, I said. My stomach growled. "In that respect, it was detente. I didn't get dinner, she didn't get dinner."

Claudine looked at me for a moment, puzzled then giggled herself. "The easing of tensions." Shaking her head, she said. "Well put, Tasha."

"The cell has been rebuilt and reinforced to hold you during the next full moon." Calmly, Susi said. "Fortunately, the sleeping gas worked, but we are having cameras installed in the dungeon to avoid this happening a second time."

I nodded then turned to Mom and Dad. "Can we stop somewhere to eat?"

Dad smiled. "I think that can be arranged."
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: A talk with the Beta couple.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
After an impressively large breakfast, I was escorted to the infirmary wing of the Woolsey estate, where I found Loveta resting in bed. She was covered from head to toe in bandages, but, fortunately, no casts. She greeted me with wide eyes and silence. I instantly knew she was terrified of me. I stood by the door with both her parents and mine standing behind me.

"You are not to blame." softly, I said. "Abby Vamp has a way of manipulating people. She tried to manipulate me earlier."

For a moment, Loveta remained silent, but she soon found her voice. "You are not here to kill me?" Slowly, she asked.

I shook my head. "I fear that was what Abby Vamp was counting on." Softly, I replied. I then smiled. "Only she forgets that you are not the daughter of the Beta couple for your radiant good looks."

After a moment, Loveta giggled before wincing. "Where do we go from here?"

I took a step closer, my face turning serious. "We need to show Abby Vamp and those who think like her that this incident will not weaken the pack, but strengthen it." Calmly, I said. "From the Alpha to the Omega, a pack is at its strongest when all members work as one." I extended my hand. "Will you help me make this pack a force of one?"

Loveta stared at me for what seemed like forever, though it was only a minute, then slowly accepted my hand. "From the Alpha to the Omega, we will be one."

I smiled. "We hunt..."

Loveta returned my smile. "...Therefore we are..."

Then we said in unison, "The oath of the moon."

I left Loveta on good terms, at least I hoped. Once out of earshot, Mom gave me a one-armed hug. "You did us proud, Tasha." Smiling, she said. "Respect is never freely given, and I believe you just earned hers."

"As well as ours." Bowing, Fang said. "If there is anything we can do for you, please do not hesitate to ask."

"There is one small thing I would like to ask." Serious, I said.

"What is it?" Curious, Claudine asked.

I sighed. "There is little chance any vampire would have been able to get close to the Gentleman Wolf restaurant without detection." Frowning, I said. "Someone had to have set that meeting up for her."

"You think someone sneaked her in?" Worried, Susi asked.

"Not only sneaked her in but set up the meeting with Loveta, which means... "

"Someone knew you two were rivals, making her the perfect werewolf to manipulate into attacking you." Frowning, Dad said.

"A thrall?" Wincing, Mom asked.

I shook my head. "Possible. Only I fear something worse: a Van Helsing."

"What do you suggest we do?" Wincing, Claudine asked.

"I suggest we call in... "
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Talking with Loveta.

choices: I decide to do my own investigation.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
"Isn't he a thrall to Finola?" Worried, Fang asked.

I nodded. "He is, but he is also the best detective when it comes to supernatural crimes and mysteries." Calmly, I replied. "Not only that, he can surprisingly hold his own against werewolves and vampires alike."

"He's of berserker blood?" Surprised, Dad asked.

I shook my head. "No, he is not." Serious, I replied. "Whatever his ancestry, he is our best shot at getting to the bottom of this, as he has a nose for the supernatural."

"I will allow it." Calmly, Susi said. "However, he is to report his findings to me first, as swift action will be required to resolve this problem."

I nodded. "I will call Aoife immediately and arrange it." Serious, I replied. "However, any details such as your demand will have to be between the cleaning crews and you."

"Fair enough." softly, Susi said.

Minutes after a brief, private telephone call, Detective Mike Sutherland arrived at the Gentleman Wolf restaurant. "Let's make one thing crystal clear." Serious, he said. "My sole mission is to determine if a Van Helsing was involved in the attack. Beyond that, it is a werewolf matter."

"We appreciate the assistance, detective." Calmly, I said. "It is very important that we maintain the peace so many have worked hard to establish between the two powers."

Mike nodded. "We start by looking for Van Helsing's signature calling card." Calmly, he said. "There is only one member left of the clan to our knowledge."

"John Van Helsing." Frowning, I said.

Mike's eyes widened then narrowed. "Victor Van Helsing."

"There are two survivors of the Van Helsing clan?" Surprised, Susi asked.

"Apparently." Softly, Mike said. "Victor Van Helsing first resurfaced when I was training Janelle in detective work." He turned to me. "Where did you hear of this John Van Helsing, Miss Lyall?"

"From Janelle." Taken aback, I replied. "She told me that he came to Nouri's looking for Finola and her associates."

Mike grunted. "Have you seen him in person?"

I shuddered before shaking my head, to which Mike sighed. "Consider yourself fortunate."

"You know them?" Curious, I asked.

"Not personally." Softly, Mike replied. "John and Victor are twins. We had thought both of them were killed years ago." He sighed. "If there is nothing else to report, I will start my investigation."
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Detective Mike Sutherland

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
"You said something about a calling card." Curious, I said.

Mike nodded. "It will be an arrow with crow feathers." Darkly, he explained. "The tip with be made of silver, so, if you find it, let me retrieve it."

I gulped, knowing that werewolves were vulnerable to silver, and nodded. "Matt saw Abby Vamp talking to Loveta Howl near the service entrance outside."

"Then that is where we will look." Softly, Mike said.

I followed him out to the service entrance, where an arrow was indeed found. Only as Mike inspected it, he had a deep frown on his face. "Is it not the calling card you were expecting, sir?" curious, I asked.

Mike sighed. "It's a vampire arrow, but..." He shook his head. "It's far from perfect."

This stunned me. A vampire arrow? I could only ask, "What do you mean?"

"It's a clever forgery." Frowning, Mike said. "Had a werewolf thrall found this first, there would have likely been a panic, and then a fury."

I sniffed the arrow then raised an eyebrow. "I don't detect the scent of a vampire."

"Which proves it's a forgery." Serious, Mike said. "However, with tensions so high,... "

I sighed. "Just the sight of this would sow a new wave of distrust."

"Exactly." frowning, Mike said.

"Only why would Abby Vamp listen to a Van Helsing?" Confused, I asked. "It doesn't make sense."

"Victor Van Helsing has been known to manipulate young vampires before." Serious, Mike explained. "He contacts them via thralls or servants of his own, and sets up telephone conversations."

I frowned at that. "Which means he had been watching her for a while." Softly, I said.

"Most likely." Frowning back, Mike said. "Abby's father, Drake D'Arcy, is impressively wealthy, but he is more concerned with his financial empire than being a vampire. Thus, Abby has it in her head he is Count Dracula, due to him carefully hiding his supernatural status."

"Which explains her power trips." Sighing, I said.

"And her vulnerability to be manipulated with a silver tongue." Calmly, Mike replied. "My guess is that one of Van Helsing's servants snuck Abby in, and, during the meeting, left the calling card."

"Giving her what she wanted, but framing her at the same time." Angry, I said. "Both she and Loveta had been played."

"It also proves one other point." Darkly, Mike said.

I sighed. "There is an outsider hiding in our pack."

Mike nodded. "I will help you find this intruder."
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Mike's investigation.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
Knowing that a delay would be costly, I relayed what we had discovered to Susi, who gave a low growl upon hearing the report. "It's most likely one of Van Helsing's thralls paid to become a werewolf thrall." she sighed. "This has happened once before."

"It was ages ago." Serious, Fang added. "Still, new safeguards were put into place. I can only guess Van Helsing found a way around them."

"What are we to do?" Wincing, I asked.

Susi frowned. "I suggest you have a word with Miss Lee." Serious, she replied. "If Van Helsing managed to plant a mole in our midst,... "

"He might have done the same to the vampires." Pale, I finished.

Susi nodded. "Detective Sutherland, your services in this matter are at an end." Politely, she said. "Miss Lyall will show you the way back to your vehicle."

Mike nodded, and I began to escort him out. "Do you have any advice for me, before we part ways for the moment?" Wincing, I asked.

"Stay on guard, Miss Lyall." Softly, Mike replied. "Peace between vampires and werewolves is a monster hunter's worst nightmare."

"Aren't there only two left of the Van Helsing clan?" Shuddering, I asked.

Mike nodded, his face dark. "As far as we know, but they are not the only monster hunters in the world."

I gulped hearing that, as Mike stepped into his car and drove away from the Gentleman Wolf restaurant.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Reporting to Susi.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
While Susi quietly searched for the mole, with the help of the Beta couple, I moved to a private room and phoned Janelle, who answered on the third ring. "Finola has already called and briefed me on the matter." Calmly, she said. "There may very well be a mole among the vampires as well. She wants us to work together in flushing them out."

"Susi is spearheading the search among the pack with the Beta couple." Serious, I said. "Would you like me to join you in questioning Abby Vamp or the vampire thralls?"

"It's a vampire affair." Remaining calm, Janelle said.

"It's a joint concern, as the Van Helsing family has invaded both powers, for the sole reason of sowing distrust." Calmly, I countered. "I will follow your lead, as it will be in vampire territory." I then smiled and added, "After all, I am a berserker, which means I fall under the non-interference treaty. I do not attack unless attacked."

There was a pause before Janelle gave a slight giggle. "I'll pick you up in ten."

I nodded, then ended the call and sought out Susi. "Janelle is having me picked up to help her find the mole among the vampires." Serious, I said. "Chances are, once we find that mole, we will find the other."

Susi nodded. "I will allow it, but I want reports on your progress." Firmly, she said. "I will be enlisting your parents' aid in this search."

I grinned at that. "I feel sorry for the mole already."

Susi cracked a grin. "Just wait until I get my hands on him or her."

Ten minutes later, Detective Mike Sutherland returned with Janelle, and picked me up, to begin our mission to find the mole.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: I call Janelle.

choices: I call Susi with the latest news.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
After a brief private phone call, finding Abby was not a challenge for Mike. It was as if he were part bloodhound or werewolf, though I was assured by Aoife it was neither. Abby was standing outside of a small cemetery when we caught up with her. "We need to talk, Abby D'Arcy." Flatly, Mike said. "It would be wise of you not to run."

Abby scoffed. "Why would I run from a mere mortal man?"

Mike gave an odd smile, which caused Abby to take a step back. "You're not... ?"

"I am." Flatly, Mike replied. "I have already spoken to your father on this matter, and he is very... displeased."

Abby frowned. "What do you want?"

"Information." Calmly, Mike replied. "It's no secret that the last of the Van Helsing clan wants to rekindle the old war between vampires and werewolves. The question is, who roped you into the scheme?"

"Give me one reason why I should give you anything?" Boldly, Abby demanded. "My father is the one and only... "

"Her grandfather is Dracula, and her mother is the daughter of Carmilla Karnstein, his first wife." Ice in his voice, Mike interrupted. "You are nothing but a spoiled rich girl who happens to be a vampire."

"And the werewolf... ?" Scowling, Abby demanded.

I opened my mouth to speak, but Mike stopped me with a motion of his hand. "You know very well that she is a berserker werewolf." coldly, he said. "She is the last girl any vampire with a lick of sense would wish to anger." He gave another odd smile. "You really opened a can of worms talking Loveta into attacking her. Within a few generations, there could be an entire pack of berserker werewolves running amok."

I blushed at that, though I tried to hide it, as I saw where Mike was going with his questioning. Abby turned pale, looking at me just as I had regained my poker face, and gulped. "I was contacted by young boy who offered me a large cooler of donated blood in exchange for a few minutes of my time." Softly, she said.

"Go on." Flatly, Mike said.

"He said is name was Vie Harris."

Mike frowned deeply. "Thank you, Miss D'Arcy." Calmly, he said. "That is all I need to know... think no further on this matter." He again gave an odd smile. "Until you see your father, that is."

Mike then led Janelle and I away from the cemetery back to his car. "What was that all about, detective?" Curious, I asked.

"Vie Harris is like me,... an immortal." To both Janelle's and my shock, Mike said. "We are normal by all human standards, other than the fact we cannot die, unless the host is willingly or unwillingly changed."

"Unless you become a vampire or werewolf." Gulping, Janelle said.

Mike nodded. "Correct." He sighed. "Vie Harris thrives on creating conflict, so I am guessing that the peace efforts are his newest target."

"So,... what do we do?" Worried, I asked.

Mike handed us a photograph of a young man. "This is your mole." Serious, he said. "He is likely working both sides against the middle.. Find him, then report to me... he is mine."
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: We question Abby Vamp.

choices: I am approached by Vie Harris.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
After returning home, I called for Mom and Dad, who came to me looking concerned. "What is it, dear?" Softly, Mom asked. "Any major trouble on the horizon?"

"The mole threatening the peace talks is an immortal named Vie Harris." Calmly, I replied. "Do you know anything about this man?"

Dad's face turned dark, causing me to gulp. "He was the only biker gang member to escape our wrath." Coldly, he said. "Had we known he was an immortal, we would have delivered him to the pack."

"The one who got away." Frowning, Mom added. "It would seem he had his sights set on disrupting the peace for a while now."

"At least we now know what his game is." With a growl, Dad said. "I take it Detective Mike Sutherland confessed his background to you?"

I nodded then gasped, surprised. "You knew he was an immortal?"

"He has been by Finola's side for nearly a thousand years, under different names." To my surprise, Mom explained. "He is the perfect bodyguard, as a vampire would have to drain him completely dry to turn him."

"A werewolf would have to eat his heart to turn him." Darkly, Dad added. "Only that is not the most disturbing thing about immortals."

"What do you mean?" Taken aback, I asked.

Dad's face turned grave. "Their clans all have one motto; There can only be one..."

"The last remaining immortal will, in theory, rule the world." Calmly, Mom said. "However, their vulnerability to be turned makes them a cautious lot."

"This immortal could be centuries old, with experience in combat that will take you by surprise." Serious, Dad said. "That, and he may be in league with the last of the Van Helsings. Do not approach him alone."

"What do you think I should do?" Wincing, I asked.

"Spread the word about him, and inform the pack not to trust him." Serious, Mom replied. "Your father and I will see what we can do on our end."

"Please don't do anything rash." Worried, I begged.

Mom and Dad exchanged a smile. "Fear not, pumpkin." Calmly, Dad said. "We only intend to talk to the city council, they owe us more than a few favors."

I nodded, though I did not feel comfortable about their exchanged smiles. As I headed off to work at the Gentleman Wolf, I phoned Aoife and told her of my conversation with them. "Is there any way you can keep an eye on them?" Worried, I asked.

Aoife sighed. "Berserkers are not known for allowing a grudge to stay unsettled." Darkly, she said. "Still, I could use their kind of muscle when we confront the immortal. Just focus on moving the peace talks forward, the cleaning crew will deal with this Vie Harris character."

With that, Aoife ended the call, and I continued on to work.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: I consult mom and dad.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
I was near the Gentleman Wolf restaurant when the sound of a dog whistle sounding close by stung my ears. I turned, annoyed, to find a tall, dark man in a black business suit, smiling at me. "Good evening, Miss Lyall." Calmly, he said. "My name is Vie Harris, and I would like to have a word with you, if I may."

"My parents are none too pleased or impressed by you." coldly, I said.

"Ah, yes, the berserkers." Still smiling, Vie said. "I must admit, they surprised me, but I am not here to reminisce."

"What do you want, immortal?" Ice in my voice, I demanded. "I have more pressing matters to attend to than deal with you."

Vie chuckled. "You have your parents' tenacity, I respect that." He then turned serious. "I have lived long enough to see the way of the future become the forgotten past. Empires fall, there are no exceptions, and your werewolf empire is at the verge of failing. But I can help you strengthen its foundation, by weakening that of the vampires."

I knew that Vie was trying to manipulate me, but I found it ironic that he did not seem to know I was a part of the peace process. "I'm listening." Softly, I said.

Vie smiled. "I know the vampire trying to manipulate the werewolves into softening their position." Smiling, Vie said. "She is the granddaughter of Dracula himself, Janelle Lee. She is young, inexperienced, and vulnerable." He chuckled. "Clearly no match for a berserker werewolf."

"What's your plan?" Curious, I asked.

"I will arrange a meeting where two of you will meet." Darkly, Vie said. "That is where you will strike her with all of your berserker rage."

I had to hold my tongue to keep myself from laughing in the immortal's face. He had no idea, and he was almost literally giving himself up to both powers. "When and where, immortal?" Forcing a frown, I demanded.

"The night before the next full moon." Calmly, Vie said. "You should be able to force a transformation at that point, increasing your odds to defeat the vampire, and force them to yield."

I nodded, though I had no intention to follow his plan. Vie nodded back and casually walked away, into the shadows. I could not believe my luck at that point. Could it had been that easy? Upon arriving at work, I demanded to speak to Susi.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: I am approached by Vie Harris.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
To my surprise, Susi seemed rather concerned by the immortal's plan. "This Vie has lived long enough to be more careful than this." Softly, she said. "We had better inform the cleaning crews of this development."

One phone call later, Janelle entered the Gentleman Wolf restaurant with her mother and father in tow. "I was approached by this Vie Harris as well." Serious, Janelle said. "He wants the meeting to be at the masquerade party the night before the next full moon."

"The local and national media will be covering the event." Serious, Mr. Lee added. "It is the perfect place to expose both powers and make them appear to be in conflict."

"That... is... bad." Frowning, Susi said.

Janelle and I exchanged a smile. "Actually, it's perfect." Smiling, I said.

"Vie Harris has no idea how easy he's made it for us." with a sly smile, Janelle added.

Fang and Claudine Howl raised an eyebrow while their daughter, Loveta turned her head, curious. Crystal raised a hand to her chin, uncertain. "What?"

"Care to explain?" Also raising an eyebrow, Susi demanded.

"I, too, am curious." Calmly, Finola said.

"It's a masquerade party, but not just any other." Smiling, Janelle explained. "It is the celebration of the end of the werewolf and vampire war."

"Dramatizations are to be expected." Also smiling, I added. "We can turn a legend into nothing more than a myth."

"How do you intend to pull that off?" Curious, Aoife demanded.

"By showing the world that werewolves and vampires are referred to here as nothing more than metaphors." Grinning, Janelle replied. "It will strengthen the Masquerade, and encourage the media to look elsewhere for their stories."

There was a long silence before Mike Sutherland began to chuckle. "You two are going to be dangerous when you reach adulthood." Smirking, he said. "Only how do we get both sides to agree to this deception at the masquerade party?"

"Both parties want the nosy media gone." Serious, Janelle replied.

"By setting this trap for Vie Harris, we kill two birds with one stone." Also serious, I added. "We get rid of the media, and we get that much closer to Van Helsing."

Finola nodded. "I like it." Calmly, she said.

Susi nodded. "Agreed."
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: We contact the cleaning crew.

choices: The Van Helsings crash the party.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
In the days before the Masquerade Festival, Janelle and I prepared the trap for Vie Harris, with both vampires and werewolves agreeing to the plan. Although their only common goal at the moment was to be rid of the nosy media, it was definitely a much-needed step in the right direction. As the festival began, there were local bands playing folk music, with performers dancing to it and, of course, food and beverage stands. There were also carnival games and a few rides for the younger crowd. It reminded me much of the Oktoberfests Mom and Dad were so fond of. Matt and Luna were enjoying the snacks from the many vendors while meeting his friends, Greg and Dusty Rune, who were all too happy to meet her. Luna remained polite, playing the shy girl, which warded off most questions for the time being. My friends, Susan and Elisabeth, remained on high alert with Janelle's friends, Mindy and Zooey. Their job was to be on the lookout for signs of Vie Harris, or either Jon or Victor Van Helsing crashing the party. All of them were instructed not to engage either of them if they wished to live.

"We are ready, Tasha." Serious, Dad said. "This is your first command of the pack."

"Don't remind me." Softly, I said. "I need to remain focused, as anything could go wrong at any point of our plan."

"We have a back up plan in case that happens." Softly, Mom said. "Susi is aware of it and has approved." She nodded to Dad, who nodded back. "We and Janelle's parents will take the immortal down, if necessary."

"What do you mean?" Taken aback, I demanded.

"When a vampire grabs you, unless you are a berserker, you are not breaking that hold until he releases you." Darkly, Dad said. "After that,.... " He sighed. "Well, it is for the best that you don't know."

"You are going to drag him into the midnight forest, aren't you?" Worried, I asked.

Dad shook his head. "Don't ask."

"Focus on your plan." Serious, Mom said. "One way or another, Vie Harris will go down for good."

With that, they walked off, vanishing into the crowd of festivalgoers. I was about to follow after them, but Mike stepped into my path. "It is for the best you do not know their plan, Tasha." Serious, he said. "What they have in mind will make them a part of the werewolf pack."

I gulped hearing that. "They are going to go full berserk."

"Only if your plan fails." Calmly, Mike said. "We have confidence in you and Miss Lee." He then gave me a strange smile. "Either way, it will be a festival to remember."
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: A festival to remember.

1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
As the main festivities began, everyone who attended was given the choice of masks, including those of a vampire or werewolf. I wore a werewolf mask, while Janelle wore a vampire mask. Loveta Howl and Abby Vamp started off with a dance-like mock fight showing the legend of the vampire-werewolf war. The two of them agreed to the plan, as they had both been played by Vie Harris, and wanted a part of taking him down.

"Legends speak of a war between these two great powers." Addressing the crowd, I said. "However, this is just one of the many legends that surround this peaceful city." I grinned, seeing Vie Harris in the crowd. "There are legends of Berserker warriors calling this city home, as well as an immortal or two. Why this particular town? Well, that is a legend all its own."

"The local Indian tribes called this place Spirit Lands where all legends emerge." Jumping in, Janelle said. "Ask the locals, they can tell you stories that date back to before this city was first built in the early 1800s."

"There will be demonstrations of many of our more popular legends throughout the festival." smiling, I said. "Please enjoy the shows, and don't forget to buy a souvenir or two to take home, from one of our many vendors."

"Interesting theme for this year's festival." Approaching Janell and I, Vie said.

"I'm glad you like it." Smiling, I said. "Janelle and I will be giving a demonstration soon."

"Sooner than you might think." Grinning, Janelle added.

Vie frowned. "You are the heads of the peace effort." Softly, he hissed. "Here, I thought it was your parents."

He saw our fathers' bonding fight. Surprised, I thought. So trying to bait Janelle and I into a fight had to have been his plan for revenge against both of them.

It darkly all made sense, as Vie Harris had crossed paths with my parents, and with Dracula himself, being an immortal. By rekindling the war, he would wreak havoc with my family and Janelle's. Still, I found it rather amusing and began to chuckle. Not long after, I was laughing in the immortal's face. "For someone who has lived as long as you have, you are quite naive!" Laughing, I stated.

Janelle snapped her fingers, giving the cue to spring the trap. Llewellyn and Blackwell took hold of Vie Harris from either side. He turned to the two vampires, before throwing me a sneer. "What do you intend to do, tear me apart?" Scoffing, he asked. "I am immortal, I cannot die by any means."

"We had planned something along those lines." Coldly, I replied. "However, as your plan was to take revenge against our parents, through us,... "

"We have decided to give you the opportunity to have your revenge, by fighting them on your own." Ice in her voice, Janelle added. She turned to Llewellyn and Blackwell. "Take him to the Midnight Forest. He is not worthy of the name Dracula."

"Nor is he worthy of the name Lycaon." Firmly, I added. "I daresay, even the Van Helsings would not want him."

Llewellyn and Blackwell nodded and dragged Vie Harris away, with Finola soon following from the crown, with Aoife and her associates, Cain and Slade, right behind. Aoife turned to Janelle and I briefly. "Come, you will want to witness this."

Darkly curious, Janelle and I followed the sisters away from the festival to the Midnight Forest.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Springing the trap.

choices: Matt and I bit our parents.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
In the darkness of the Midnight Forest, I looked about, hearing the growls of the timber wolf pack. Then, I saw them running ahead of us, with Matt running with them. Behind us, I saw members of the pack following in strange robes while carrying torches. I looked ahead to see more members of the pack in the same strange robes, also carrying torches.

"What is this?" whispering carefully, I asked.

"The calling of the moon." Darkly, Aoife whispered back. "An ancient ceremony among werewolves, when they induct new members into their pack."

I gulped, knowing that Mom and Dad were going to be the ones inducted. That only meant one thing: they were going to go full berserk upon the immortal. Only to do that, they would have to first change the host. This is going to be messy. Worried, I thought.

We reached a clearing where the timber wolf pack had gathered around the edge, growling and snapping, with Matt leading them, as if he were the alpha wolf. Blackwell and Llewellyn half carried, half dragged Vie into the center of the clearing and dropped him before quickly leaving, standing on either side of Finola behind the pack.

"This is a werewolf affair now." Calmly, she said to Janelle. "Whatever happens, stay at my side."

"Remain next to me, colleen." Firmly, Aoife said. "You are about to witness your family's berserker legacy."

With Cain and Slade shadowing me, I watched intently as Susi entered the clearing, confronting the immortal. "You are naive if you think I am going to let you just bite me, werewolf." Snarling, Vie said. "I have lived for thousands of years!"

Susi shook her head. "I am not the one who will bite you." Darkly, she said. "Only a true descendant of King Lycaon can change an immortal."

Vie raised a single eyebrow, then howled in agony, as Matt leaped from nowhere and sank his fangs into his shoulder. Vie cursed, stumbling about, trying to throw the wild boy off of him. Eventually, Matt jumped off and ran back to the timber wolf pack, as Mom and Dad stepped out into the clearing. I cringed, seeing that their eyes were glazed over, as if in a trance. The members of the pack began to hum a strange and haunting tune, moving their torches in an almost hypnotic manner.

"Eyes forward, colleen." Strictly, Aoife ordered. "Unless you wish to be lost in the berserker trance too."

I tried to keep my eyes forward, on the action in the clearing, but the humming and movement of the torches was hard to ignore. It seemed to call to something within me, but I managed to keep myself grounded, as Vie began to transform into his wolf state.

"I will not lose to a pack of wild dogs!" Grunting, Vie yelled. "I will not be changed!"

"The pack does not want you." Coldly, Susi replied. "You are nothing but fodder."

That was when the humming stopped and the forest fell completely silent. All the color drained from my face as I saw my parents' transformation...

They both grew from six foot humans to twelve foot giants with their muscles growing and bulging to Olympian status in a mere moment. They opened their mouths, revealing rows of sharp carnivorous teeth, before they roared. Their combined war cry literally shook the trees before they charged Vie with a speed I was barely able to follow. I wanted to cry out, but Aoife firmly gripped my shoulder in warning, and I remained silent. Within seconds, it was over. Vie Harris was dead, and Mom and Dad were unconscious on the forest floor, their anger fully spent.

"As promised on the first full moon after the birth of Tasha, Henry and Nina Lyall shall join the pack and become the new Alpha couple." Solemnly, Susi said. She then motioned Matt and I forward with her finger. "As their children and members of the pack, you shall induct them, with a simple bite to the arm."

This came as a shock to both Matt and me. We turned to each other, gulping, then turned to our parents.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: the death of an immortal.

choices: Mom and dad's first full moon.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.content:
For a brief moment, Matt and I were hesitant, but the strange humming and movement of the torches began again. I felt myself falling into a trance, and, before I could stop myself, I opened my mouth wide and bit deep into Mom's arm. Her eyes opened wide and she turned to me with a momentary look of fear. Only that fear was fleeting, and it was quickly replaced with a loving smile. "That's my girl..." Whispering, she said.

Matt bit deep into Dad's arm, and his eyes opened, only he did not show fear. He chuckled before roughing up Matt's hair. "You'll have to bite deeper than that, sport." Bemused, he said. "Don't hold back."

Matt teared up, obviously not wanting to hurt Dad, then bit harder with a whimper, to which Dad pulled him into a warm hug. "It's alright, son." Softly, he said. "It's all a part of the life of a werewolf."

Matt was crying at this point, with Dad comforting him. I was near tears myself, as Mom then hugged me. "It had to be done, Tasha." Firmly but kindly, she said. "We are all now one with the pack."

"I bow to the new Alpha couple." Politely, Susi said.

"Not while the peace talks are in progress." Politely, Dad countered. "We will remain neutral, until a treaty is signed." He then smiled. "That, and we need time to adjust to our werewolf status."

"A very wise decision, Mr. Lyall." Calmly, Finola said. "Also, well said. You will make a fine leader of the pack."

"Your compliment is appreciated, Finola." Kindly, Dad said.

"I say this calls for a celebration." Smiling, Susi said. "The festival is still going strong, let us all enjoy it."

Cheers and howls from the pack made the decision unanimous, and, once Mom and Dad were treated for their bite wounds, Matt and I followed them to the festival.
1211111111111112111111112121112112111212.title: Matt and I bit our parents.

13.content:
A had to spend the night in the hospital. The doctors ran tests for everything. Rabies because of the wild animal bite, you name it, they ran a test for it. Fortunately, everything came back clear. My bite wound was healing nicely, as well.

The worst part of staying there was talking to the authorities, however. At first, it was animal control. Since it was an animal attack, it made sense. I told them what it was. Some kind of huge dog or wolf. Bigger than anything I had ever seen before. It was obvious the animal control guy didn’t believe me. He kept saying animals that big don’t match any canine species on record.

However, I also had to speak to the cops. Because of the other woman who was... well... eaten that night. The hardest thing I had to do was look at a picture of her body and identify if it was her. There was not much left, from the looks of things. The beast had torn her to bits.

My mom came and picked me up the next morning to be taken home. I still had to wear my bandage, but, overall, I was fine. Cleared and everything. All I wanted was to fall asleep in my own bed and try to forget this ever happened.

“I don’t want you going out alone after dark anymore, okay, sweetie?" Mom said to me. "The police and animal control are gonna do more night patrols until whatever did this is caught and killed.”

I was only half paying attention, to be honest. My mind just kept drifting off to that... beast... the last thing I really remembered about it was those eyes... the piercing, almost glowing, yellow eyes...

We got home some time later, as I locked myself in my room and just wanted to be left alone.

I stared at myself in the mirror and sighed. I knew I was never much to look at, as prom memories seemed almost worse than almost getting eaten alive.

I was only about 5’2, and about 30lbs heavier than I wanted to be. My stomach and thighs shouldered way too much of that burden. The one place I wanted some more fat was boobs. However, Mother Nature had no such plans for me. It seemed I was destined to stay a 32 B cup forever.

I had black hair I kept about shoulder length, but it was a mess. I never put the time I needed into it. What with my greasy skin and large glasses, I kinda figured, what was the point?

Kicking off my shoes, I felt something kind of off as I lay down on my bed. My socks felt ripped.

Rolling my eyes, I pulled my feet up as I saw my socks weren't just ripped... they were punctured. I pulled off my socks and saw my toenails had actually pierced through them quite easily.

I normally kept my nails, both finger and toe, cut as short as I could. I had nobody to impress, so easy was best for me, normally.

However, as I stared down at my toes, I had to blink and check myself several times. My toenails had all grown longer. Not just longer, but they all had little points on them. Like they grew to sharp edges. They weren’t that long or anything, but they sure felt sharp. I checked and felt them several times to be sure.

I had no idea what could have caused this, but I was in no hurry to find out or ask questions. I quickly grabbed some nail clippers and chopped those little toe claws back to size.

I prayed I had just neglected them way worse than usual, and that I was just exaggerating things. I was still exhausted from everything and decided to take a nap, as I lay down and closed my eyes.
13.title: Coming Hone

14.content:
There are two ways to become a werewolf: being bitten by one and surviving, and being the offspring of two werewolves. The offspring of a human/werewolf relationship is a viewolf.

Werewolves in their human state gather in packs, with a family, or bloodline, at the center. The pack is led by an alpha, whose chief assistant is a beta.

Werewolves change on three nights per lunar cycle: the night of the full moon, the night before, and the night after. They have full cognitive abilities when transformed, but don't think as clearly on an empty stomach.

Werewolves can heal from any non-fatal injury. They age more slowly than ordinary humans, aging one year for every five years.

Fire, silver weapons, and dismemberment are the only ways to kill a werewolf. It takes a pretty big fire to kill a werewolf, but burns take longer to heal than other injuries. A silver weapon can kill a werewolf, but, if it is not placed to kill instantly, the weapon must be left in the werewolf's body until death. Removing the weapon early will allow the werewolf to heal, and you will now be faced with an angry werewolf. Dismemberment is best left to other werewolves and vampires.
